text: The taste of Taiwan nostalgia!
Very disappointed. would give Zero if i can Soggy oily and tasteless, nothing compare to 7 years ago.
Never disappoints. Huge Asian chicken schnitzel. Super tasty, crunchy on the outside and moist on the inside!

The chicken breast tastes juicy with crispy skin, never tried this before and that was a good experience. However I was surprised that there is only one staff in charge of everything, so the waiting time was quite unpleasant. Hopefully they'll optimize it in the future.

I got a fried chicken here around 6. Unfortunately, the food is undercooked.after eating i felt stomachache terribly. I took unfinished chicken back to their store to deal with the drama, but it‚Äôs closed. I need an apology! Don‚Äôt go there except u wanna a diarrhea!
The quality is different, everyone fried, the taste is different Hope to strengthen staff training
This time the chicken chop is thin enough, the bones are thicker than the meat

ORDERED: üçó‚Äã Hot Star Chicken with chicken salt, chili and seaweed ($10.50)  REVIEW: With insane amounts of customisation, Hot Star Chicken is so good, so oily but so bad for your health. You can choose to salt your chicken (up to a maximum of 3 items): pepper salt, chicken salt, cajun, chili, cheese, seaweed or no flavour. With the spicy level, you can choose less spicy, more spicy, less seasoning or more seasonings or even both sides for no extra cost.  As a base, Hot Star only season one size of your chicken which I found more than enough flavour. You also get little compressed bones at the bottom, but that's a refreshing change after working through the fried batter and the juicy tender chicken meat.  It's a great uni-fast food meal that gets you full. It's in a convenient location and even better with a gong cha to wash it down (usually the restaurant next door).
Refused to serve me due to ‚Äúbeing busy‚Äù. I was willing to wait and didn‚Äôt rush, bad attitude as well. Weren‚Äôt even close to closing and yelled at us.
The flour wrapped in the fried chicken cutlet is very fragrant, and the chicken cutlet itself is also very good, but the chicken bones underneath are not very convenient to eat.
It's so unpalatable, the chicken chop is chicken breast, not marinated well, it smells like chicken, the shell is completely separated from the muscle, so disappointed
Very slow! Waited for 30 minutes for the order!
Good value good size
I ate two by myself and it was delicious enough!!
Chicken skin was undercooked. Chicken had bones. Overall terrible experience
the chicken pops and cajun fries were a religious experience. i literally couldn't focus for the next week because i kept thinking about the bloody chicken
Delicious üòã Unfortunately, the batter is too thick
Poor attitude and very unpalatable, no fried crispy plum noodles, just a little bit

I love hotstar large fried chicken, I usually order cheese and cajun flavor. But this time, I tried the chicken salt flavor just to try. It is too much salty.. too much. I know its chicken salt flavor but all I can taste in a bite is salt. this comment is for improvement purpose. I still love my chicken in cheese.
The worst fried chicken ever, meat is not fresh at all!!!  It stinks ü§Æ And the service attitude is very bad too..  Used to eat every time come down to city, but not going to buy anymore.

I ordered the Hotstar chicken and mushroom. Buy any 2 items and you can get a drink for $1 for the combo. Be prepared to wait as the food is cooked fresh to order.  The chicken was very flavourful and juicy especially with chicken salt seasoning. The mushroom was really crunchy too. The service was really friendly as it was my first time and I was confused and the female staff member helped me with the ordering process. The food also has to be eaten straight away or it will get soggy.  The wait during the lunch rush can be quite long as there is only 1 staff member juggling frying, ordering and seasoning , so if you want your food fast in under 5 minutes I wouldnt recommend coming here as there are a ton of fast food places nearby. Overall a good experience and I would return just for the chicken but maybe not for the other food items as it's quite expensive and you only get a small amount ....

Hot Star kept us full over covid and now! We love their chicken and fries. Easy service, great set up and its quick! Worth a try and make sure you take a pic... or it didn‚Äôt happen ü§™ #supportlocal anyway you can! See my insta and TikTok for more @splitthebill ‚Ä¶

The salt and pepper squids were excellent I also really liked the chicken until I found this HUGE annoying bone that make this snack not very easy to eat outside Unfortunately this bone was ridiculously oversized ... would be perfect without
Delicious, any other small fried food is also delicious üçÄ
Good food and service. My English is not good but there was a waiter that help me because he speaks Spanish too. Victor, from Spain. The only bad point I that the food was a little sensitive

We came here for lunch as a group and did not enjoy our time at all. The restaurant was practically empty, but we still were waiting outside the restaurant for 10 minutes for a table (despite having a booking). We ordered via the QR codes and all the food for the table came except one dish, and the staff were extremely unhelpful. Further, we were given a dish completely different to the missing burger, but the waiter informed us that the dish would be free for us as it would have been thrown out anyways. As a result, we split the extra dish and didn‚Äôt think much of it. After 45 minutes of waiting for one burger, we asked for someone to let us know when the food would be arriving as everyone else had already eaten. The manager was cold and unaccommodating, and went around the table asking everyone for their receipt and what they had eaten (even though almost everyone at the table had finished eating ).  He also specifically checked the receipt of the missing burger, but refused to acknowledge his team‚Äôs error and was indifferent toward our group. We thought this was very rude as, instead of accomodating for our group and acknowledging their error, the manager was demanding proof from us that we had watend exactly what we had ordered. After asking for a refund for the misplaced burger, the manager bluntly told us that it would take 5 days to come. The overpriced items on the menu do not reflect the poor quality of service. Over the course of our meal, the servers refused to make eye contact which would make us have to get up in the middle of our lunch and request extra sauce etc. Further, for a place that charges almost $30 for a burger, the toilets were shockingly dirty. Because of this, we won‚Äôt be coming back here.
Expensive food. Limited choice for vegetarians.
Terrible service and toilets were dirty. Food was not worth the amount of money we spent. Won‚Äôt be coming back again.
4 us went to dinner early enough to get the happy hour drinks. Good quality food. Ordered via QR

Yesterday at lunchtime, my family and I had our first dining experience. We found the food to be delicious, but the service was a bit slow. Nevertheless, Eric, the manager , was very apologetic about it.
The food is a rather pricey considering its so simple - $36 for a basic burger, fries and a drink, the size seems pretty small. The service is good and staff are friendly.

So dissapointing. The steak was all fat. Very expensive.  We couldn't eat the steak. When asked how the meal was I was honest and said it was fatty and inedible, the waiter said " we will let our supplier know" truly? When the "chef" cut that steak they would have known. Save your money. Yuk.

I didn't try the food, just a couple of towers we share. Good drinks, nothing exceptional, but the price was fair. Nice spot in Melbourne Central.  Negative: The glasses were old and the toilets dirty.
The service was exceptional. We were served by Setyawan, he was very friendly and anticipating my needs. While the food was really good! Highly recommend it!

A staff with spectacles ü§ì I guess his name is Diwas. He provided a great service to us.He was so cooperative and frank.We were so amazed by his work. He was taking orders , making drinks and serving them on tables by himself.üëèüèæ Hardworking ü´°
The worst customer service ever üòµ‚Äçüí´ ‚Ä¶
Delicious food, friendly staff, great cocktails

TGIF's $10 cocktails during happy hour are unbeatable! The vibrant atmosphere and friendly service make it the perfect spot to unwind. You can't go wrong with their Long Island Iced Tea or Long Beach Iced Tea. With a wide variety of delicious, expertly-mixed cocktails to choose from, it's a fantastic deal that keeps me coming back for more. Highly recommend!  Their wings are pretty decent too.
Staff were lovely, this chai has 0/10 caffeine in it tho
Great coffee and sandwiches! Lovely service. fun relaxed atmosphere
Good food and service - and next to a great library (SLV) that Melbourne/Victoria should be proud of. Dan, you need to adequately support the SLV

This is a great place to start your while waiting for the library to open and work there, you also have the option to sit outside. The staff is super friendly and will greet you with a smile, some of the people working there speak French and they are happy to talk to you in French. In general it is a very welcoming place.
Great place for coffee
Great cafe! Delicious coffee and extremely friendly service. Michael is amazing and so welcoming to all customers - highly recommended!

Coffee is good. Food is ok, a bit pricey for the portions. Paid $21 for the Dusty Recovery (store bought croissant, hash brown, smoked salmon and poached eggs hollandaise sauce, tiny side of avocado). Poached eggs were beautiful, for the portion of the meal though it's a bit on the pricey side.
A beautiful venue next to one of my favourite places in Melbourne. The staff are lovely although at times a little hard to catch. Food is delicious and coffee is top notch.

Pretty ok coffee and selection of snacks, sandwiches, banana bread etc.  Whilst Google says a 5pm closing time, at 4:53pm a waiter came over and rudely told me to leave because "they'd closed at 4:45pm". No problem if the published times were wrong, but think he needs to work on his tone talking to customers, even at the end of the day!
it's laptop time
More than 15 mins to wait for a single takeaway coffee at 1.30pm. The place was not at all full. The food may be good, I can't comment, but I don't recommend it at all if you want to grab and go.

Beautiful cafe with friendly service. Coffee is quite good, and you can visit the library easily. Unfortunately, the operation of the cafe seems very disorganized, with multiple staff members checking in on a single table, an order being taken multiple times, etc. Unsurprisingly, this lead to errors in my order each of the two times I visited. The fare itself is fine, provided you get what you ordered.

I searched ‚Äúvegan‚Äù and found this place, always happy to support anywhere that has vegan options! In saying that - I would not recommend this place to someone who‚Äôs vegan.  I had a vegan sandwich and a coffee here. It was advertised as $12.50, the server said ‚Äúthat is meant to be $13, I need to change it‚Äù  and charged $13. It‚Äôs just 50c but felt like a poor move.  The sandwich was beetroot, pumpkin, avocado and spinach. The avocado had seen better days and the beetroot was a dip that was incredibly bland. I asked for some aeoli or tomato relish to make it a bit more appetising but it didn‚Äôt help. Im not a fussy eater but I didn‚Äôt end up finishing it. Pretty disappointing.  Coffee was decent. I paid for a large coffee to go but they ended up just giving me a regular. I was on a time crunch so I just took it and left.  Venue is nice.
Fairly priced cafe in cbd a breath of fresh air compared to overpriced establishments serving up overpriced garbage
Order but wait for an hour then he said it‚Äôs not in the system. Worst customer service
Great juice!

Atmosphere is nice with inside and outside seating. Coffee leaves a bit to be desired unfortunately. It's not likely to be a spot I'll come back to. The outside seating is a plus but the food and drink needs to see some improvement  for it to be more well regarded.
Discovered this cafe by chance and it‚Äôs so worth it. Great breakfast menu with wholesome choices. Friendly service. Definitely recommended
Very nice place just besides the Library with special offers like Happy Hour, nice people.
I worked here one day last year, they didn't pay me, I asked many times, but I still didn't get the money
Ordered a smoothie, so expensive and it turns out it was mostly crushed ice, could barely taste any fruit. Music was very loud.
Slow service on coffees, need two barista's (inside) during busy times.
Great food and service, wife and I loved the cappuccinos, kids loved the smoothie and freshly squeezed juice.
The food was absolutely phenomenal, and the staff were truely so kind to us, couldn‚Äôt recommend more.
Nice venue, tasty food
good service

Great atmosphere staff are always friendly, highlighted by the pleasant ambience  within the dining quarters ....with ample space used elegantly  around the 1930"s  theme bar. Accompanied by delicious food and beverages complimented with adjoining balconies  overlooking a beautiful view of Melbourne's Architectural Treasures....
Good prices and Omar super friendly
Heaps to choose from the menu. It's a great place to go- after hour work drinks. Service was surprisingly fast considering we went there on Friday and the place seemed busy üëç

Incredibly slow service. Understandably a Friday night but over 25 minutes for 3 Arancini balls and very nearly an hour after that for a veggie burger is pretty average.  Cool vibe, but if you can't feed people the vibe doesn't really matter
Can honestly say nothing was too much. Service fantastic.meal delicious and cheeky banter too
Brilliant bar right in the heart of the city.
Order a camber bake horrible not melting the bread soaking in the oil 0 for the chefs The staffs really nice tho Hopefully the kitchen staff will improve very soon I couldn‚Äôt even eat ..

After getting positive reviews from friends to visit Father‚Äôs Office, the experience was hindered by the music offered by the DJ when it came to dancing. It was very inconsistent and hard to have a good time with. However, if you are looking solely for drinks after work, it is a pleasant venue.

I made a booking at this place for 8pm on a Sunday. Granted, it was a public holiday, but less than an hour before the manager texts me to say they are closing the kitchen early and last call will be at 9. I've worked a lot of hospo before but never worked anywhere that would have even considered closing early when there's a booking. After 4-5 texts back and forth (while I'm trying to enjoy a comedy show) and pointing out there aren't a lot of other places with availability, he begrudgingly agrees to hold the kitchen for us. Service wasn't much better when we got there. This place has seen better days.
Highly recommended if you want drinks in the area, the happy hour is great prices and also got great food and bargains on different days worth a check

Wouldn‚Äôt recommend. While they advertise specials and happy hour times very clearly, they fail to mention anywhere on the website and menu that their kitchen closes at 8pm. Extremely misleading and left us with a really rude shock when we booked a table for 7:30 and ordered starters and drinks, only to then be told ‚Äúkitchens closed‚Äù at 7:50pm. No heads up from the server when we clearly arrived for a meal, and we were bluntly dismissed by the server behind the bar when we asked why the menus had been removed from their app. Should have known better when we walked in and the place was close to empty. Never had an experience like this at any other establishment and hope to never again.
Worst Espresso Martini ever!  From a tap with coco.  Made out it was a happy hour special.  Even had the hide to charge $12.
Makes a simple impression, the coffee was very tasty, small freshly prepared snacks to take away from the deli counter, clean seating areas, friendly service.

The food is awesome and the ambiance is amazing but their customer service is especially amazing, specifically Omar, props to him, made me feel incredibly welcome and was incredibly attentive. I would 100% come back
Food is delicious. Manager is extremely friendly, I remember him from last time and I was impressed then. Thank you

Absolutely splendid experience. Great venue with amazing views. Friendly staff. Yummy food. Cheap drinks. Happy hour. Suns out. People smiling. Loved my time at fathers office.  Make sure you grab an outdoor seat if the weather permits it!
A smooth chilled out and easy to find bar, with a classy interior and nice views over Swanston Street. Great for after work drinks.

Pukar, Yash provided the best service I‚Äôve ever experienced. Friendly, accomodating and everything you could ask for. I would highly recommend anything having a 21st at this venue. Food + drinks were brilliant. 5/5.
Fantastic burgers with gluten free options,  very tasty and the service was top class and very quick
Able to order food quite quickly. Our table waitress was not the most welcoming or courteous, but she could have been having a bad night..The food was lovely I do recommend üòÄ
So so food

My acquaintance and I came here for their Birthday dinner only to be met with crumbs on our table. Disgusting! The only crumbs worse than those on our table were the vagrants who occupy this serviette-less establishment. Food was decent.
The burgers are alright. Somehow underwhelming (single burger on a huge plate).
Very nice staff
The freshest food I've ever received from any Grill'd store before....good service too!
Healthy hot burgers of excellent quality and good maintenance of the place I recommend it
Pretty good burgers, friendly staff and competitive prices. Plant based burger was good but I especially liked the zucchini and sweet potato chips üí•üí•üí•üí•üí•. ‚Ä¶
The meat and bacon were not done, the burger probably was done quickly, finally just inedible
Very good
The GF burger bun was delicious
Great spot, great service, but they got no bacon when I there. Devastating to the soul
Burgers and chips are good
Good burgers and decent salads! Can't really ask for more

Pretty annoyed about my experience at this one. I always love Grilld and love how friendly the staff are but after a massive mess up of my order all I got was a rude and dismissive response.  I ordered on the app and selected pickup time on New Year‚Äôs Day. It was late but the restaurant was still open for an hour when I placed the order and I was able to order on the Grilld app.  I arrived at the restaurant at my designated time after hearing absolutely nothing for over half an hour I got a phone call just as I was walking in saying that they can‚Äôt make my order. I asked why I wasn‚Äôt told before as I just walked all the way and it‚Äôs late so things are now closing and the staff members response was ‚ÄòI‚Äôm calling you now aren‚Äôt I‚Äô  I couldn‚Äôt believe the response, no sorry or anything just straight back chat. I‚Äôve always loved that the Grilld staff have been really nice so this was quite a shock. She then said she could give me a refund, I was confused by how this was worded because she had to give me a refund. She then tried to refund me less money than what I had paid and not included the holiday surcharge.  I‚Äôve never said this about anyone before but I honestly think that staff member should be sacked because that is not the kind of attitude you want to be representing your company. I have also never left any review less than 5* before but I‚Äôm really annoyed about how I was treated here.
Plenty of seating and great staff.
Beautiful burger

Bit overpriced but the girl with the fringe that served me today was extremely polite, she went above and beyond for me. Staff were amazing and the food was tasty!!! Did take a while to get food though‚Ä¶
I tried the Wagyu BBQ burger and it was very tasty.
Service was good. Atmosphere was good but beef patties where dry in our experience.
Food was okay, the chicken dumpling was not good. Service was ok.
Waited for chicken rice takeaway for 20 mins and they said they missed my order. After I asked, it was ready in 2 mins.

Paparich is our favourite from Malaysia, they have best coffee, roti Chennai and ayam curry. From breakfast to dinner they have many tasty option. Located in mall so convenient to access but the place closes early so check your timing as this is not something open late night.
They microwaved my food after they served it cold. Never coming back
Good location.  Very nice tasting meals, with a  good choice of different types of food.

Delicious and absolutely love our meal at paparich! Clean and bright interior and service is polite.  Recently student edge has a deal with paparich such that a meal + drink is only $15.90. You will need to download the student edge app to redeem plus bring your student card. Only for 3 selected dishes and 2 types of drink.  Take note of surcharge on Sundays and public holidays.
Have been to this restaurant few times and still love their food. My favorite aretheir prawn noodle soup and chicken satay.
Horrible malaysian food ever had,

Visited PappaRich in a party of four. Good selection of foods with vegetarian options available. Staff brought out one dish very quickly but then the rest took quite a while and we‚Äôre all very staggered, with the last meal coming well after the first meal had been consumed and then the dumplings came after the main meals had been served. We also were given another table‚Äôs food and not our last meal so everything was a bit all over the place but flavours were nice and food was all enjoyed. Just could have been a better serving experience. Surcharge on a Sunday is also crazy to me. If you can‚Äôt afford to be open normally on a Sunday maybe don‚Äôt be open. Don‚Äôt make customer pay for more if you‚Äôre only going to give average service.
Very dry hard Roti today‚Ä¶.normally soft & fluffy. I really hope Your not using frozen? A little disappointing
Good food and fast service. Waitstaff were fast. However we order OJ, the quantity was half of the glass was bubbles only. Not a reasonable price to be paid.

I wanted to order the Wokkein noodles with the exception that I did not want a particular ingredient included in my dish. The staff did not comply and came up with excuses saying that they were new staff and could make such changes. I wasn‚Äôt really asking for much and found it very disappointing that they couldn't do a simple change to my meal. In the end, had to eat a dish that was not very satisfying. Never going there again.
Paparich in QV deliveries great Laksa and Char Kway Teow. The menu has been revamped with more additions. Great service here.
Got food poisoning here on Thursday. Still recovering today.

The interiors remind me of the cheapest eateries in south east Asia. The food came out almost immediately which can‚Äôt be a good sign and wasn‚Äôt-dry chicken skin, overcooked chicken, tasteless dishes‚Ä¶Regretful visit.
They‚Äôre noodles are too salty and the flavor was basically just soy sauce , not to mentioned they charge 19.5
Decent laksa, but with no veggies (like eggplant and greens) other than tomato, so it was slightly disappointing. :(

Wanted to try their food, arrived at 08.28pm on a Wednesday. Had to go back since they said they were closed for new orders however google says they are open until 9pm. You should update your timing if there is any change rather than misguiding people.

PappaRich offered casual Malaysian/Indian-influenced meals at reasonable prices. The food quality had been relatively consistent over the years and so was the efficient quick service. My favourite was the hainanese chicken rice paired with congee.
Charging $1 for a take away container on a $65 order. Times must be tough

Very disappointed with the service. We were 4 and 3 of our meal came in. The 4th mean wasn't there until we 3 finish ours. Call the waiter and she check and said 1 min. Another 15 min pass and nothing then call another waiter, explain the same thing but again nothing. Later call another and the guy with black dress came out - thing he is a manager and he said it will be there and again nothing. So we have to ask the same thing 5 times and have to take away the food. There was no cutlery and so asked to put that in and gosh another wait for just o add cutlery in order. Asked if we have to pay and the waiter ask guy in black desk and he wasn't interested to even give discount. Won't be going back again to this PappaRich.
PappaRich is a good restaurant chain. The QV store has a big seating capacity. The kitchen and bar are huge too.
Fake
Wait until we finish ordering, they said that we couldn't bring outside drink, the chicken rice was not delicious, and I went home and vomited.

Ordered the roti telur which came with 3 dipping sauces. So tasty brought me back to Singapore hawker centres. Had iced tea with 3 milk combination. Price affordable though service a little slow.  Staff not chatty as busy. Definately. be back to try other dishes.
In QV so naturally still good location. Food wise abv average.

I had a chicken curry as I got a voucher from an event 'shop the city' the other day. It was delicious and good spicy level. I am Japanese and found this curry is a same taste when I had a Japanese curry in Japan too.  I was surprised there was a long queue when I came. This place must be popular. Foods' prices are reasonable. Friendly staff.
Karaage curry was very tasty. $17 for a large was pretty good

My favorite comfort food since 2011 my uni days till now when I‚Äôm on Holiday üòä The most favorite dish : 1. Kay‚Äôs Chicken (4.5/5) 2. Chicken / Pork Japanese Curry with Rice (4/5)  Strategic located in the center of QV The price was unbeatable cheap perfect for studentsüòç Taste always consistent and never disappointed Will always come back when I visit Melbourne
Nice little casual place I like to visit with my friends for a quick but to eat. Menu is relatively affordable with a decent range of options
Still my favourite place to get japanese curry and Kay's chicken since uni time like 15 years ago
Delicious food, fast service, good staff üëè
The tofu curry was ok but needed more curry for the amount of rice provided.

Tasty. Quick. Affordable. Healthy. Convenient. Would give this place ten stars if possible!  Have been eating here for more than five years now and the taste is still the same! Delicious! And I hope this never changes!  There is just something about this place that reminds me of home. I wish to some day eat at this place with my kids and tell them I have been coming here for a very very long time!  Never change! We love you for what you are now and forever will. Thank you Hanaichi!
Liked it
Decent katsu curry with reasonable price.
Beautiful food and atmosphere.  Lovely setting too. The staff are lovely and friendly also. I recommend this restaurant to eat.
Good food with good prices. It's convenient that everything's already takeaway.
From my experience one of the best value lunches in cbd.  I had Kay's chicken and loved it.  Good quality chicken pieces unlike many competitors.  Plentiful seating.
Good value of good
One of my favourite places to grab Japanese food, the Kay's chicken is brilliant
I come to this place to remind myself of my uni days, except now I have money and the same amount of depression. 10/10 would karage again. Still great in 2023.
I ordered a set of cutlet curry and rice bowl. was delicious.

Schnitz used to be great.  Utter garbage now, clearly franchised out with no care at all.  Cold food, filthy store but hey it's QV, you know you get the foot traffic so you don't care about quality.  It's funny how the good reviews have replies from management and the poor ones are ignored.

Waited half an hour for food in an uncrowded restaurant. One meal was lukewarm when it arrived and one meal that was piping hot but had chicken that looked like it had been cooked by a flamethrower - charcoal black. No apology for the wait and very disappointing overall experience.

Group of 6 all ordered individually but sat at the same table. 5 meals delivered but the 6th meal (which was ordered first) had to be chased up with 2 requests to staff and finally was delivered after everyone else at the table had finished eating.

Today I got the plain and simple wrap and it was delicious. The girl who served me was absolutely lovely, and my dog also loved her. We are very happy with the kindness and amazing service given today.  Made the slight wait for food well worth it. Thank you guys!
Salad was old and mouldy
Love how they are open till 9pm but dine in closes at 8:30 despite it not saying that on their website nor have we had this happen before when dining in. Woman wasn't polite about it either

I‚Äôve been eating schnitz fairly regularly and today there was a win in the seriously overflowing bag of chips but a loss in the chicken schnitzel that tasted kind of hard in places and possibly not cooked properly (which I cut off just to be safe). Still a big fan so I can‚Äôt say it‚Äôs put me off ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è ‚Ä¶

Poor quality service and food. Had to wait 40 minutes for food. Average taste and very oily. The serving time management is surprisingly shocking. It was 5 of us went there for late lunch around 3:15, the restaurant was not busy. We all ordered 1xchicken schnitzel and 3xchiken parmi and 1x Caesar salad. . They brought the first dish (chicken schnitzel) and the waiter disappeared when I asked were is the rest of the food, she said it will take time. In what restaurant on an earth you get the food with that much gap and served separately. I mentioned the first dish is already getting cold as we were waiting for the rest. The waitress took the dish back in. The salad was pretty average as well. The schnitzel in it was burnt and dry. With Just tiny smashed avocado aside. We would have left the restaurant if we could. Feeling sick after that as the food was bad quality and oily. I don‚Äôt recommend it at all.

I ordered Garden of Eden Burger just coz I love Beetroot and the other veggies in it. However, this time I got it without the beetroot and when asked the person said we have run out of it. My question is why as consumer we are not told while placing the order? Please let ur diners know that you are out of something.

Use to be quick service here but lately the wait is very long. Maybe because you have so many Uber eats orders at lunchtime and have to get them ready. Meanwhile long line of customers waiting and customers waiting for food for over half hour I think it‚Äôs wrong that the person taking orders has to also serve the food that‚Äôs ready. Get more staff if you‚Äôre so busy? Also noticed it‚Äôs so hot in the store! So many aircon units and none are on Very bad in summer . It‚Äôs cooler outside on a 30 degree day than inside. Get your air con fixed or turn it on!
Decent enough
The food is delicious. Environment is clean and tidy. All the staff tonight went out of their way to find me a power adapter so I could charge my device. Very kind individuals.

Terrible service, tall white guy with black hair and likes to wear jewellery has an attitude and gives bad service. Everytime i go there, i have to wait for 30mins for a burger and some chips even though there‚Äôs barely any customers in the restaurant. They didn‚Äôt call out my order when it was ready and when i finally asked for it, thats when they brought it out. food was already cold, i don‚Äôt know how their store is surviving with this low level of service.

Ordered through the schnitz app for takeaway and waited 35 minutes for 3 wraps and 1 family chips with 3 cooks in the kitchen and only 4 or 5 tables occupied. Once we took it back to the hotel on a 30c degree day it was not even warm enough. Possibly the worst schnitz branch there. Avoid this place at all cost!
got served absolute vomit, this place is horrendous
The sauce that you have eat with the chips costs $1.2 and tge amount is very tiny It's very over priced, and it's supposed to be provided with the food for free

Absolute disgrace, food was served cold and although it took 40 minutes for something I could make at home in 20, the meal looked rushed out of the kitchen and they forgot to add some toppings and salted the fries when asked not too...  Appalling service of a business that obviously doesn't care, if I was a teenager I wouldn't work here just out of respect to myself. Replying to negative review's seems to be the only thing they are good at.

Very cosy vibe and friendly staff. Will be coming back for more.

Went to Amphlett House with the family which included young people of school age and we all thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience, the staff are tremendous and very helpful and nothing too much trouble. The ambience is very pleasing, easy going and makes for a very comfortable place to either sit and have a long drink or a fabulous cocktail and watch the world go by. The food was the icing on the cake! They cater for vegans which is quite a rarity and it certainly did not disappoint! My granddaughters are both Vegan and thoroughly enjoyed their meals which is so refreshing to be able to all eat out and be catered for together with all different requirements ( great stuff!) The rest of our party had various other dishes and all the plates were left clean!  I myself had the Mussels which as others have said, were utterly delicious and yes I too left a clean plate! The menu is sensible and wonderfully varied but not bombarding,  prices are very reasonable too and right in the theatre district, its well well worth a visit anytime, you will not be disappointed, check it out!

Had a very delicious meal here on our first night in Melbourne City, lovely atmosphere, great staff who are very attentive, the food was superb and we were not rushed, we even had a visit from the chef. Wonderful experience, Would recommend.
Excellent food, great menu choice. Food was served in good time. Very friendly staff and great atmosphere. Wil definitely be dinning there again!
Been to Amplett House a few times now. Food is next level with excellent service. Will definitely be back.

Chef Ian Curley has done it again - this place is seriously good. There‚Äôs a nice, intimate, gastropub feel that offers some intimacy from the attached hotel and the bustle of Little Bourke.  There are a few veg options but the menu is protein dominant and mostly British-inspired. The ox tongue and the harissa spiced fish scotch egg are must-try dishes and err more on the playful side of pub fare. The mussels are also standout.  Cocktails are great too but if that‚Äôs not your thing, there‚Äôs also a large and varied selection of craft beer.
The food and service was amazing with a great beverage list with a good selection of craft beers, local.and international wines and cocktails.
Enjoyed the food, staff friendly, knowledgeable about food and wine, service was good, not intrusive,  atmosphere and decor classy.
Good food, friendly staff, great atmosphere. The perfect place to grab a drink and a meal after work.

Wow what a find.  Great food, delicious cocktail but best of all the best customer service I have ever experienced.  Everyone was so pleasant, happy and genuinely cared that we enjoyed ourselves. Wishing all success
Lovely staff, good drinks and great atmosphere üëåüèºüëåüèº ‚Ä¶
Wow customer experience with great customer service with a smile. Will come back when I am in Melbourne. MUST TRY THE AMAZING RANGE OF UNIQUE BEER

Totally amazing!!! Kept going back during my stay in Melbourne. Everything on the menu is 1st class. Staff are the best around. So attentive and made us feel so at home. Can't wait for my next Melbourne holiday just so I can go back there.

PS my dining partner had the Cr√®me Br√ªl√©e with freshly baked (to order) madeleines and the BEST chocolate sauce. Do yourself a favour and try this place #notsponsored

Everything came together at this place - delicious meals and drinks at reasonable prices; a chill, comfortable vibe that was extremely easy to spend a couple of hours in; and very friendly staff that made us feel extremely welcome. Would definitely come back again!!

Pretty chill vibe at Amphlett House.  Not sure why I paid $18 for a "High Ball".. It was just a Gin and Tonic...  Got some entrees to share before heading to another venue. The duck parfait had a strange grainy texture and weird after taste. Wouldn't recommend.

Cozy restaurant. We stoped by without reservation. We had excellent service by Chris and all the staff. The food was good, but not exceptional. I would recommend for anyone who wants to have a decent meal at a decent price.

Ordered avocado on toast with fried eggs ( had requested fried eggs) as the original recipe said poached , the guy on the counter said oh we can definitely do fried eggs, when the order came through got poached eggs . Ordered for a mocha,  got a cappuccino told the guy on the counter he said oh sorry and just hot me a chocolate sauce on the side to make my own mocha !! What away to ruin the morning .

UPDATE: SEE BELOW.  So It's been one heck of a year. So you can imagine my enthusiasm to come back to the cafe where it all began... It is to my dismay to inform you all...... "The Benny" is gone.  We returned twice after COVID hoping to see The Benny in all its glory. To have our tastebuds touched by an angel once more. It seems the cook has either changed, or those wonderous drops of balsamic reduction and pesto have packed up and moved away.  I beg of you if you read this review, please inform me when they have returned from their holiday.  ------------------------------------------------------------------------ Old Review Jan 2020  I dont usually write reviews, but buckle in for this bad boy...  Atmosphere here is great for a sunday brunch catch up with family or friends.  Ordered the Eggs Benedict, "Benny" they call it and my lord was it good.. The poached eggs were the best eggs I have ever laid my eyes on. Wasnt sure if I was going to eat them or propose to them. Everything about the meal was delicious right down to the little drops of garnish on the side.  Ordered a Caramel latt√® and low and behold.... you bet your bottom dollar it was great...  Service here is friendly and don't pester you about how your food tastes during your first mouthful.  Now.... for the payment.. greeted with friendly staff once again and to my surprise didnt have to sell a kidney...  All in all, would I recommend this place? You bet ya I would. Will I come back? Definitely..

Lovely atmosphere on the roof top, don‚Äôt worry, there is heaps of shade and tables in remodelled shipping containers. Food was fantastic, saturday also seems to incur a surcharge. Absolutely would not recommend. I'm a bit shocked by the good reviews it has, makes me think they might be fake reviews. We were sitting in piles of water as the shipping containers were getting flooded. We got the fish tacos and it was most likely frozen fish fingers deep fried with mayo on top. Despite being deep fried the fish came out cold.. the guacamole on the "nachos" was basically the stuff you get pre made at supermarkets. Incredible disappointing as it's supposed to be a Mexican restaurant, the least you expect is a fresh guac.  The wait staff were nice at least.
The best Mexican Restaurant in the CBD.

Can't say I was happy at the Happy Mexican Rooftop. But first let's start with the good. Drinks were lovely and I'd recommend coming here for drinks. The Mexican pale ale was nice and the cocktails were decent, albeit expensive at $21 a pop. Staff were also trying really hard in some really ordinary weather.  The food on the other hand was some of the worst I've had in Melbourne. Fish tacos were just a bit of battered deep fried fish with red cabbage and a ton of mayonnaise, not nice. The eggplant tacos were just fried eggplant with no proper sauce and simply tasteless. The nacho chips were ok but the guacamole reminded me of the guac dip you get at the supermarket.  In a nutshell I wouldn't recommend coming here for food.

If you're looking for a great Mexican restaurant that serves delicious food and has an amazing view from a rooftop, then this place is definitely worth checking out!!! The atmosphere of the restaurant is top-notch, with an open-air setup that provides an unforgettable experience.  The highlight of this restaurant is the impressive selection of craft beers, particularly the hazy pale ale, I simply love it!! It's definitely worth trying if you're a beer lover.  As for the food, the chilaquiles with beef is the standout dish. It's well-prepared, perfectly seasoned, and absolutely delicious. The portion size is generous, making it a great value for the price.  Overall, if you're looking for a fantastic Mexican restaurant with a great rooftop view, awesome beer selection, and mouth-watering chilaquiles with beef, then this place is a must-visit.

Hey Team,  I‚Äôm disappointed on how your display your menu items in Food Delivery Partner platforms. (Eg: UberEats).  All your ‚Äòmeal‚Äô choices come with chips. We ordered: ‚Ä®- Hitsumabushi (eel on rice)üçö‚Ä®- Ichi-rashi (sushi and sashimi on rice) üç£‚Ä®- Black sesame latte üñ§  The hitsumabushi and ichi-rashi dishes were both oustanding. The eel in the hitsumabushi was perfectly grilled. Likewise the egg was on point  and we had fun mixing the toppings which resulted in well balanced flavours. The ichi-rashi featured an array of fresh sashimi served over sushi rice. The presentation was beautiful and we enjoyed every bite! üòã The black sesame latte had a rich nutty flavour from the sesame paste. It was a nice complement to the other dishes we ordered. üôÇ Overall, Ichigo was a fantastic experience with a nice cosy atmosphere. Whether you‚Äôre looking for a casual cafe brunch or a full hearty Japanese meal, you won‚Äôt be disappointed!‚Ä®‚Ä®‚≠êÔ∏è Our rating: 8.5/10

Went for the first seating with a few friends. This is my second time here. Let me start with what I liked: The service is great! The food came quickly, ordering was smooth and pretty fast. Our request for extra dishes was also quickly delivered. All the wait staff were friendly and approachable.  The atmosphere is quite nice and warm. The ambiance is simple, they're not trying to do anything aesthetically outstanding - it's a chill restaurant. What I liked is the space was well lit (not doing that strangely dim or overly bright look) and it isn't very loud, so you can actually hear your friends talk - love that for a dinner catch-up.  Now, the not so good parts. Honestly I would give the food a 2/2.5, but that seems a bit harsh for how much meat they served up. The portions are good, definitely filling, so that's a plus, but the flavours were not a hit across the board. Some dishes were delicious, others left much to be desired. There wasn't much consistency with the seasoning or tenderness. Sometimes you'd get a rump steak that's beautifully seasoned and perfectly cooked, then you order more because you're keen and get something that's too salty and under-cooked. Also, as someone who loves grilled corn or any corn for that matter, their grilled corn was legit too sour, I do not know what they put on it, but most of us did not enjoy the corn. Such a shame, because like I said I LOVE CORN and could've eaten many cobs, if it was actually tasty. Can you tell I'm sad about it? I really was... Who messes up corn?! The sides were alright though, especially the fried banana yum!  The last time I came a few years ago, the meat was more consistently seasoned and cooked and I would've rated it a 4/5.  That said, I think it's just a matter of consistency. Quantity is not everything unfortunately and for that price, I think many people will want good quality across the range of meats.  I might try one more time, maybe.

Been going here for 20 years and moved to Sydney. Recently came back to try the new location and was utterly appalled. I stuck to their classics:  Salt and Pepper Chicken Ribs - Undercooked and where the oil was obviously not hot enough to make the batter crispy and was soggy with oil. Add onto that the fact the salt and pepper was totally bland with not enough five spice or garlic or SALT!  XO Pippis - what the hell happened here? The pippis, once their trademark dish have now become pathetically small and not live; definitely not the large plump ones of yesteryear. Not only that, there were broken shells all over the dish and was surprised I didn't chip my teeth.  The third dish was not even worth mentioning as it was so poorly cooked. As I said, absolutely no excuse and boils down to lazy bad  chefs when no one is in the restaurant and the food was cooked with  a care factor of zero!  I have told many many people to come here over the years and be sure to them all to avoid it as there are many suburban restaurants 10 times better than this place!

Nelayan Restaurant is a fantastic seafood restaurant located in Melbourne. From the moment you step inside, you are greeted by a welcoming and friendly atmosphere. The d√©cor is modern and elegant, with subtle hints of the sea and nautical themes. The menu at Nelayan Restaurant offers a wide variety of seafood options, from fresh oysters to succulent lobster. Each dish is expertly prepared and beautifully presented. The standout dishes include the grilled barramundi and the soft-shell crab, which are both perfectly cooked and bursting with flavour. The service at Nelayan Restaurant is exceptional, with attentive and knowledgeable staff who are more than happy to make recommendations or offer wine pairings. The restaurant also has a great selection of wines and cocktails, making it the perfect place for a romantic dinner or a special occasion. Overall, Nelayan Restaurant is a must-visit for seafood lovers in Melbourne. With its beautiful d√©cor, excellent menu, and top-notch service, it is a true gem in the city's dining scene.

Were from Sydney and me and my partner decided to have a long weekend at Melbourne. On her birthday was a Good Friday us and our friend went hunting for a restaurant to celebrate, when we came across this Nelayan Restaurant.Ordered two types of fish and soup and my friend decided to order two choices on the bain marie a rice with  liver and kangkong (water spinach) as she was digging in on her meal half way she saw a big red rubber band which we taught was a chili but she confirmed it was a red rubber band.She was upset and called the waitress and showed her the rubber band. 1st the waitress apologies then offered a new plate but my friend was already not in the mood for dinner and advise the waitress to advised the chief to make sure that to check throughly before serving the food. A few minutes later the waitress cameback and gave $16.10 back. I had then returned the money back to the waitress and told her we have no intentions of making an issue our aim is to make sure that does not happen to others this is why we flagged it and before I returned to my table I said all good...You would THINK she would say THANK YOU NO she did not and even the chief I would thought that will come out and apolgies NO did NOT...I was not going to write this review but is it upsetting RIGHT.. Kindness it does exist but people dismiss it and ignored which is very SAD. Please remember this name NELAYAN....

The ramen here is perfect and it reminds me of the a really good ramen that I had in Tokyo a few years ago.

This is exactly where I come when i think of ramen on Russel street, but then normally it is too late and I realise where i am, standing outside in a thin coat and huddled over the list, the list!  I have watched so many good people contort themselves around to view this list from the right perspective, watching the shoulders tuck in like an Olympic diver and the hips slowly follow, the neck reaching out to purse at a name, pointing without an elbow, beak like, pecking at a name that no one else but the person who wrote it can read. Amazing place. Food was lovely saw some awful critters for customers there. But the workers were reasonable with the kind they were dealing with.

Good food, but very salty ramen broth making it hard to finish and there weren‚Äôt many options for people who can‚Äôt have pork, there was no alternative broth or meal replacements. Staff did not allow an outside alternative meal indoors.

tried both flinders and russell st outlet  broth was flavourful, portion was generous and pretty worth it for the price paid (10% off cash payment or there‚Äôs a liven promotion for card payment) flinders st provided 2 pc of thin pork slices which was slightly too over cooked and tough. russell st provided 1 pc of thicker pork slice and was much more tender and well cooked. the meat is a crucial part of ramen so i would return to russell st and skip flinders st outlet.  especially after the service staff at flinders st cleared away my ramen after i told her to leave it.

Their dipping ramen is the perfect al dente texture with an umami broth that is the just the right amount of salty and spicy. Nothing that burns too much. Gyoza, whilst overpriced (like most places) is quite tasty and crunchy.

really nice food and service.

New Kum Den is a popular Cantonese restaurant located in the heart of Chinatown in Melbourne. The restaurant has a simple decor with white walls and wooden tables and chairs, creating a casual atmosphere that is perfect for a quick lunch or dinner.  The menu at New Kum Den is extensive and offers a range of Cantonese dishes, including seafood, meat, and vegetarian options. The standout dish is the salt and pepper squid, which is crispy, spicy, and packed with flavor. The roast duck is also a must-try, with tender meat and crispy skin that melts in your mouth.  One of the things that sets New Kum Den apart is their commitment to using fresh ingredients and traditional Cantonese techniques to create dishes that are authentic and flavorful. The dishes are also consistently excellent, with bold flavors and generous portion sizes.  The service at New Kum Den is friendly and efficient, with staff who are always happy to make recommendations or accommodate special requests. The prices are also very reasonable, especially considering the quality of the food and the generous portion sizes.  The atmosphere at New Kum Den is bustling and lively, with a mix of locals and tourists enjoying the food and the atmosphere. The restaurant can get busy, especially during peak hours, so it's a good idea to book ahead or arrive early to avoid a wait.  Overall, New Kum Den is a fantastic Cantonese restaurant that's well worth a visit for anyone who loves authentic and flavorful food. Whether you're a fan of traditional Cantonese dishes or just looking to try something new, New Kum Den is sure to impress.
Good except no location
poor service
The coconut chicken was cooked in fresh coconut water and the chicken was juicy and tender.

The pork intestine chicken pepper milk broth was quite delicious. A little toooo peppery however it was well seasoned and went delicious with the rice. Intestine is an acquired taste, and chicken was a bit dry but it's ok. The golden yolk prawn was veryyyyy delicious. Hot and crispy and flavoured to perfection, the shrimp was so tender and juicy, almost bursting in your mouth.

Coconut chicken hot pot is so amazingly delicious! They use coconut water for the soup and boil a whole chicken in it. Also comes with tofu, glass noodles, enoki, napa cabbage. The dipping sauce was so good too.
The best soup dumplings in Melbourne hands down, every time I‚Äôm in the city I try and make it here

This nicely presented gem tucked on little lonsdale Street was nothing short of a treasure trove of old skool Cantonese dishes. Truly a taste carried by the previous Kum Den in chinatown, this is a much neater and modern venue with a taste of old skool Cantonese cuisine.

We had a fantastic time at New Kum Den on the Chinese New Year eve. The coconut chicken hotpot was good as always. The steamed fish was a ritual for the new year eve. The staff provided excellent service. Moreover, there we saw the lion dance and the firecrackers brought us back to childhood. What a memorable evening! Thanks New Kum Den. I wish you a prosperous year.
nice!

Taste is just so so, not sure why it‚Äôs popular though. Also the receptionist is rude. Great food and service. Will not hesitate to come back again. Highly recommend the pepper pork stomach soup, deep fried large intestine and steam prawns with vermicelli.

10 points recommended, what I called pepper pork belly chicken stew that day is really delicious, and it is very warm, I will recommend friends to come here immediatelyü•πü•πü•π, a rare good soup base, and it is very cheap

Bomba has been a mainstay of dining in the East end of Melbourne for years now and has always done it well - great service, great tapas menu and we love the Worker's Lunch.  It survived through all the lockdowns and still is a fabulous place to go for a relaxed lunch or dinner with terrific staff.  I could not recommend it more highly..Julie  I ate the Worker's Lunch again with a friend yesterday - May 12/5....this is a fantastic menu for $25 each and as always the food was wonderful and the service excellent.  The slow cooked braised beef was as good as any piece of beef I have ever eaten.  Bomba rocks as always!  Julie

Excellent experience!! So good wow. Mantaditos were mind blowing some of the best food I have ever had. The tapes themselves were a little underwhelming compared to the mantaditos however. Service was fantastic. Cocktails and drinks were fantastic.

But, Very romantic ambience and can find a few moderately dark cozy corners for lovers to have a private dinner feeling. P1 Wagyu and chicken liver good.  P2  beef tongue tastes good, it‚Äôs tender but it‚Äôs very sour, I hope the chef may consider about my opinion to lower the sourness of it. The octopus is just average level, not amazing or surprising, but just very average. The pork belly is ok, I like the combination with the almond, but my girlfriend said she doesn‚Äôt like it. The bone marrow is the best of the night, it taste so good, we both agree that one to be the best one of the night, if you find it hard to choose the tapas, this one is a must! The spanner crab salad is the second best, I love the taste, and the crab meat taste so fresh, love it!  P3  croquet is good with melting cheese in it, and the capsicum is the alternative choice we had that night since they don‚Äôt sell the burnt peach on menu any more, I think the capsicum one taste fresh and sweet, but maybe I am too familiar with Mexican food, the flavor of it is not a surprise for me. P4 the lamb shoulder paella taste good, the lamb shoulder taste tender and delicious, but my personal suggestion for others who wants to try it is not to squeeze too much lemon juicy on it, it will  influence your experience of tasting it in a bad way; and I think maybe a little bit more chopped parsley could do better. The potato sides are good as expected and the chipotle sauce is really good! P5 deserts are my regressions that night, the egg tart crust is not crispy at all, the bottom taste sticky and chewy, like the pastry is raw, it is definitely a disaster! The other one is the cr√®me Katelyn( I can barely remember the name of it) all I remember is the crust on the surface is just too hard and too thick! I am really not expecting it to be like that!  If it is not the desert that night our experience should definitely be 4-4.5stars, but the desert just kills my mood and appetite, I hope the chef may notice my comments.

Note we were at the rooftop bar. Everything was great except the music was too loud. We had to practically yell to talk. They did turn it down a tiny bit when asked, but still not an environment to catch up with old friends, which is what we were doing.

A close friend is Sri Lankan and I worked at Tamil Feasts for years so I'm familiar with the cuisine and this is not authentic SL or delicious by any standard! After trying curries from here three times the third time leading to a bad stomach,  I consider it my civic duty to warn others about the place.  The curries are horrible! They're really sweet and don't have any diversity or subtlety of flavour.  And I've tried them all. The curry puffs are excellent though. However I highly doubt they make these inhouse. Craving for some Sri Lankan food, this was the closest I could find in the CBD so I went along with a friend. We both ordered a regular combo plate ($13.90) that consisted of savoury rice, meat curry (butter chicken), 2 vegetables (lentils and mushroom curry), papadam & your choice of chilli or chutney (I took curd). First, the positives: decent portion size, nice flavours and fast service. The negatives: small space, not very clean tables and a bit over priced for the menu.  As for the food, the lentils could've been cooked better. It was hard. The rice wasn't actually savoury. The little amount of curd on the side was simply a joke.  Unless in a pinch, I wouldn't highly recommend this restaurant.

I opted for the eye fillet and there were also five different side dishes to share.
