Don‚Äôt bother going there, service is super slow, expects to wait for at least an hour before getting your food during the weekend. Lack of staff, small serve and not really authentic.  The place is a bit rundown, dirty and sticky floor. Not recommended.
It is a very good traditional Japanese restaurant, definitely worth going to!

Guys! Let's be serious, I don't get the 4.3 rating.... ,Food  is bad! We tried to provide feedback but we were told no one else complained so surely the flood must be good. I don't seen any reason why you would go there, food, service or atmosphere...

Although the food is flavoursome, they will down portion the main to an entree size. We ordered salmon steak as main and got 80 grams of salmon on a sizzling plate. Ordered Chicken ju which was batter with bits of chicken in them for flavoring. Also ordered beef yakiniku (or something along those lines) and got bean shoots with slithers of beef. I can't stand places downsizing food and charging full price and leaving you hungry.
Really long wait time. It's been close to an hour and I still haven't gotten my food :(

The saddest Oyako-don I have ever seen on earth. It had no flavour, dry, and the egg was throughly cooked to a big clump. Tasted like nothing and not even the soy sauce on the table could save it.  My partner ordered a main of yakiniku and it had like 10 pieces of beef that costed 16 bucks‚Ä¶ there‚Äôs more hot plate to see then there is meat????  The floor had only one waitress and it was busy, but our food took ONE HOUR to arrive.  A total waste of time and money.
Yamato restaurant is a good restaurant. It has lots of food and deserts. You can find all of the Japanese food in Yamato restaurant.
Normal place to eat.
Quaint and intimate Japanese restaurant that feels quite authentic. I ordered the salmon bento box and it was very fresh and delicious. The staff were lovely and hospitable.
Experience but worth it. Great place, best food.

One waitress only covering 30 customers. Everyone must order and pay at the counter and then grab the water from the counter. Interestingly, they have the option to use Japanese floor mats for floor seating (2 tables available at the back). To go to the toilet (clean), you need to walk all the way through the outside alley to the back.
Good yuncha with lots of variety Must get the cute and creamy custard buns

Amazing food! Typical Hong Kong style service - quick, effeciant but can but cold (or  some people might find it a bit rude?) The place can be a bit cleaner thou, where we sat the floor was a bit sticky

Atmosphere was the only thing that was decent.  Food quality- Came from Perth to Melbourne to try the quality of dimsum. Dimsum was terrible and over priced compared to Perth. Taste was below standard as well as portion was smaller than I'd expected.  Service at the start wasn't good, booked for 4 with 3 adults, 1 toddler and 1 infant- The guy was stressed out when I said 3 adults and 2 kids when I booked for 4 seats and almost had an argument- Might have been a language barrier or miscommunication.

We had Tim Sum for lunch. Lots of varieties that you can't find in other restaurants. The food was yummy, and service was top-notch. By lunchtime, it was fully booked. A fee will be charged for all credit cards and Eftpos.

Our friend invited us to secret kitchen for Yum Cha after their wedding registration. Food was authentic service was great. They helped with the cake we brought from Laurent, would recommend secret kitchen to everyone. I have been to their CBD Chinatown branch and Doncaster Westfield branch.

Looks can be deceiving and this was the case from the laneway outside looking in at Secret Kitchen. Once inside, impressive decor and lighting and lovely friendly service. Ordered BBQ duck and pork meat platter with side pork and prawn fried rice and seasonal greens. Very nice ,tasty and delicious food, however a touch more expensive than you expect with your normal Asian fare. Was it good ....yes. Was it the best duck ever ... not quite. Would I return and dine here again ........ absolutely so, especially to try the Yum Cha menu perhaps instead.

Came here couple times for yumcha but recently back for dinner. The food was average, a little bit salty but customer service was shocking. A middle aged male staff was extremely rude, legit nearly yelling in front of all of us, making sarcastic comments and give out unnecessary negative vibe and ruined the whole night. The other staffs were ok. We know it‚Äôs Saturday night but legit we don‚Äôt need the staff to start yelling at customers when ordering, basic etiquette is at least needed. People please beware before going here.

One of the worst experiences we have ever had at a restaurant. Food was great but the customer service and energy of the place was pathetic. It feels like customers are nothing more than a dollar value for these people
So, so, so good. Dim sum is certainly one of the best in Melbourne and EUGH, the chicken feet are so good!
The food is delicious ü§§ Recommended Recommended ‚ò∫Ô∏è

I was shouted a meal here, so don't want to be too harsh, seemed overly priced for the fair. Small portions at diffrent price points..  hard to keep track of spend.  2 or 3 dishes where excellent, the fried prawn  pastry thing was actully amazing, prawns had that big prawn flavour and fresh..padtry really nice and most of my stars are here for that, standout,The chinese broccoli with the housin type sauce..  that sauce should go on nearly everything (maybe the fried prawn thing too)  and prbly the only real vegetable you can order.. lastly which is something I never eat was the octopus, I had some and I quite liked it, I was sure I wouldn't, so a real surprise, I ate most of the serving. But the rest of the food was just dumplings which pretty much all tasted alike, nothing special.  Worth going once. But I'm not running back considering portion and price.
Excellent yum Cha, very busy , very authentic

I have eaten many Cantonese morning teas, and this one is my favorite. Each has its own good products, and here, the overall is very good. Some friends from Guangdong told me that this restaurant is very authentic. Came here to eat with friends. Fortunately, we booked in advance, otherwise the queue would be really long. Regarding ordering, they will push the cart directly. It is very convenient to choose a lot of ready-made food directly, and you can taste many kinds. If two people eat a lot, about 150 can eat very well. There will be surcharge on weekends, and the overall price is high.

The last time we went there for yum cha we had great food and service, however, this time was quite disappointing.  We brought our own wine and was prepared to pay corkage charge as it is fair and reasonable for restaurants to charge $10 - $15 per your own bottle but to be charged $10 per person is way too excessive. The wait staff said that we were allowed to bring one bottle and there will be a corkage charge, BUT have neglected to tell us how much. Then before we had settled into our seats we were prompted to order.  We immediately ordered the Steamed Red Rice Crispy Prawn Rice Roll from their popular dim sum menu and it was a waiting game. After five reminders to different wait staff, we were told by a very attentive and apologetic waitstaff that it wasn‚Äôt passed on to the kitchen. By now it was near closing time so we ask to cancel but was told to wait a further 10 mins. when the special deluxe dim sum finally arrived; it was obviously a rushed job as the RED rice crispy prawn were barely blushing pink rice roll with only one rice roll filled with crispy prawn and the rest were stuffed with vegs. The overall experience was not great this time round.

Amazing service, fast & furious. Quality food with very high quality ingredients (we ate at a few yum cha places with trolley style and so far this is the best). Of course, quality for money, there are cheaper places but not as top notch as this one
Honestly the best yumcha I've had in Melbourne by a long shot
Good service. Dim Sum is good but not best in that price range
The food tastes Cantonese~ The service is good~ The environment is good~ Unfortunately, there is no morning tea dim sum menu at night~ ü•≤Many people in Guangdong drink night teaü§£

The service was outstanding on Saturday night. The food came out fast and tasted delicious. They were able to seat out 2 year old on a booster seat and give him small cutlery and plates to eat off. Very good for families. Definitely recommend
Absolutely delicious food. Staff are very attentive and friendly.
Great food service and value for money
The menu is varied and delicious
Institution
Nice chinese restaurant.
Absolutely incredible experience
best yum cha in town, 6 years of consistent quality of service and food!

Food was delicious, but the service was really subpar. Presented the bill before we finished eating. Rushing to clear the table for 2nd round of crowds supposedly, but the restaurant was at best 50% full and many empty tables even on a Saturday peak dinner time. Consider improving the dining experience otherwise plenty of choices in the Chinatown to not go back to this one. Delicious food is not worth it if the overall experience is memorably bad.
good service attitude
Delicious yumcha, meticulous and friendly service, reasonable price! Ten years old diner!
Brilliant.  Best Chinese in China town... and anywhere else.
Authentic and delicious.
Institution for Melbourne and the yum cha scene. Our kids loved it.
Good place and the yum cha for lunch is great.

The food is OK. But horrible service, the staffs have severe racial discrimination. If you are white people, you are treated well and get a table soon, if you are Asian, you need to wait. The staff throw cups and dishes facing down on the tables and have no sense of hygiene.

Whilst the food was quick to be served and lovely, our party of 5 were seated close to the kitchen entrance. We could only assume that there was an open rubbish bin around the corner of the partition wall as there were 5 small flies constantly flying over our table. Throughout our entire meal we were seen swatting flies which were attempting to land on our food. When we complained to a staff member, she said ‚Äúoh really‚Äù and looked up but did nothing. To top the night off our senior male waiter had the personality of a wet mop and also forgot my drink order. He didn‚Äôt even acknowledge us when we were leaving‚Ä¶. Just rude really. I was very disappointed as I‚Äôve dined at Shark Fin twice previously and really talked it up to my other dinner guests. We won‚Äôt be going back again
Food and service was amazing. We had a banquet for 2. We also had cocktails which were delicious. We will definitely be back.
Good n friendly service with beautiful food at a reasonable price. Plenty of smiling faces.
Proper Cantonese yum cha experience.

We had a firday night dinner at Bodega Underground and as we booked rather late we were seated at the bar. We had the ‚Äúfeed me‚Äù menu which was delicious and everything on it was gluten free. The gluten free churros were outstanding!  While the ambience of the bar was nice(underground style) we felt that the staff could have been a bit warmer and friendlier. Overall was a good experience and we would be back for the food
Very average food at an inflated price.

Absolute shocking experience. They force you to get the feed me menu which is really just another way of getting more money out of you. We wouldn‚Äôt have ordered half the things they bought out. The food was terrible, drinks tasted like petrol, staff were inattentive. We asked them to take 3 plates full of food away  due to it being so bad and they didn‚Äôt even ask if everything was okay. Biggest waste of money, have no idea how they have such good ratings, don‚Äôt waste your time.
amazing gluten free food!
Their margaritas are fire üî• Their churros too. Great night.
Food was phenomenal! Good place to go for Mexican and some drinks.

I had an amazing experience at Bodega Underground restaurant located in Melbourne CBD. It's truly a hidden gem that you shouldn't miss. The highlight of my meal were the Tacos De Fruoles, made with black beans. Chilaquiles roja - it was simply awesome! The flavors were so rich and authentic, I couldn't get enough. The ambience of the restaurant is also super awesome.  I highly recommend making a booking in advance as these guys are always booked out. I'm glad we did, as it ensured we got a spot at this fantastic restaurant. The service was fantastic and the atmosphere was warm and inviting.  Overall, if you're looking for great Mexican food and a wonderful dining experience, this restaurant is definitely worth a visit.
Great vegan options and superior mescal list! This place has a really fun vibe too and the service is excellent

Bodega had gone viral on tik tok so I decided to check out. Corn, chicken wings were the best. Lamb dish and taco dip was very average though they were highly rated. Staff are amazing but their outfits are a little too laid back. The girl serving us looked like she woke up and came to work in her home clothes. But she was a nice girl. So overall good place to try but not what I expected . Churros were the worst
One of our favorite restaurants in our whole month long trip to Australia. Everything was so fresh and amazing. Staff was super helpful and kind and drinks were fantastic. Highly recommend!

Overall good inexpensive food but the noise level was way too high for early in the evening. We were also seated at the front door and every time it opened there was a loud shrieking noise - door hinge definitely needs WD40!

This place has a great atmosphere. It was pretty full at the time. The menu was very different from other Mexican restaurants I have tried however the food was was not quiet as enjoyable as what I expected. I‚Äôm pretty sure half the order was forgotten and then done in a rush only after I asked about it 15 minutes after getting the rest of our food. I was disappointed with the experience.

Found this little gem open at 11.30pm Friday and couldn't be happier! The food was amazing, cocktails were amazing, the people serving us were absolutely fantastic even making us a secret cocktail.  Will 100% be back for more tacos and cocktails üç∏

So much fun, the vibes were kind of dark, religious Mexican iconography, music was awesome, and the staff were super sweet (even though so busy); our server Shen really took her time to explain the dishes and drinks, easy, no fuss, Super yum yum.

Fantastic place to eat. Great variety of dishes with options for different food restrictions. Chill vibe, very friendly staff and service (shout out to Zac for being a legend and friendly). The tacos were fresh, filling and a nice variety of options. Definitely coming back.

One of the best bottomless brunches you can go to. We went here at 11am for a bottomless brunch and Bodega Underground did not disappoint. The bottomless includes a 5 course meal and unlimited cocktails within a 90 minute session. As soon as we sat down our first meal came out and our drinks order taken. Within 5 minutes our drinks were served. Once we were halfway through our first drinks, our waiter came up to take our next drinks order without hesitation. We were allowed to change our cocktail of choice constantly and we were never without a drink as he consistently checked with us if we needed another drink. The food also came out as soon as we were finishing up the previous meal and so we were never without food as well. The food was actually amazing, as were the cocktails which were all of great value. The staff were all very friendly and very efficient. I would definitely return here for another bottomless brunch.

Been sick all day from the food here. Don't believe the positive reviews they must be bots/ people who were too intoxicated to remember the food. Tacos tasted like cardboard and the ribs were fatty with no meat. Sauces and seasoning (lack there of) were poor. Most of the food seemed microwaved! Service was mediocre and we were rudely rushed out by one of the waitresses. Plenty of nice restaurants on Little Bourke and you can pay the same price and eat much better!

Very busy so book early. Because it's busy you would think the food was exceptional but it left me underwhelmed. Must admit the corn it's to die for and the service always gives it extra stars, but you have a time slot so the food is rushed out which gives a get in get out vibe.  Not sure why but one of our friends slipped over and no one helped!

A fun Mexican restaurant! Had the pre theatre dinner and we were absolutely stuffed afterwards! Great value for the variety and amount of food, including drinks and dessert! The corn is a must-have and packed full of flavour.

On Ftidays and the weekends @bodegamelbourne do a fantastic brunch deal. It‚Äôs a set menu which starts with elote and finished with churros with a delicious dulce de leche. The dishes in between were fried chicken wings, chicken chilaquiles and birria quesataco. Everything was delicious and packed full of Mexican flavours.  There is a decent list of Mexican inspired cocktails that we quickly made our way through. We particularly enjoyed the Paloma. At $75pp for lunch and free flow this was a great deal.  The restaurant itself is bustling with people enjoying their Friday lunch. The service is efficient and while not the friendliest we were looked after quickly and got everything we needed.  This is a brunch I would happily do often.
Food was amazing. A little noisy and we were ushered out pretty quickly so we couldn't enjoy the space as long as we would have liked to.
All our food came out at once, whereas we had ordered entree then mains, which was a bit annoying, service was friendly and food was good
Yummy food and drinks and very quick after ordering.
Wicked margs and great dishes. Vegan friendly too.
Great spot for a late night feed.

This is a must-go for gluten-free or coeliac diners! The fish taco is amazing and the churros are a dream given you can‚Äôt find gf churros anywhere else. We also got the lamb ribs which were a bit oily for my liking - but then again, that‚Äôs how lamb ribs are so if you are ok with fatty meat then you‚Äôll probably enjoy. Will definitely come back here - mainly for those fish tacos!
Great atmosphere and vibe.  Friendly knowledgeable service.
Love don‚Äôt tell Aunty in Surry hills and Daughter in law is just as good Prepare for great food, beautiful decor and fabulous cocktails
Excellent

Waste of money and time!!!! ‚õîÔ∏èüö´üëéüëéüëéüëé Being honest, it was an awful experience yesterday. ‚Äî Overrated ‚Äî Expensive ‚Äî Portion is very less ‚Äî Sub standard taste ‚Äî Not good quality served for this price $$$ Overrated expensive sub standard quality with less portion being served‚Ä¶ !!! The ball of happiness turned out to be ball of sadness- 4.5 Aud for each piece is total waste of money‚õîÔ∏èüö´üëé !!! Creamy curry croquettes- another disaster for a price of 6.5 aud each. You can get better, delicious with a reasonable price in other eateries for sure.üëéüëéüëéüëé !!! Basmati rice - you could still feel it was not properly drained and prepared- another disappointment from unauthentic Indian restaurant !!! Lastly unauthentic butter chicken - OMG you could a better version in other restaurants e.g chin chin or khabbay or capati for sure who love to try delicious food with reasonable price. üôèüôèüôèWith due respect, it is not recommended for people who do not want to throw their hard earned money for such a overrated expensive food ‚õîÔ∏èüö´üëéüëéüëéüëé
It's an amazing experience, and I enjoyed it really well.
The food at Daughter in Law is so delicious!! We keep coming back! Service is always top notch and the vibe is really cozy.
Appalling experience. Booked for a two hour sitting, were rushed to order then served  huge amounts of food over 45 minutes, before being presented with the bill. Never again‚Ä¶‚Ä¶

We had a wonderful evening. The food (banquet) was delicious and  we loved the chai icecream sticks for dessert. The service was really efficient and unobtrusive. The pink walls cast a flattering glow over us all. Thanks!
It was an amazing third experience last night. Quick service. Amazing food. The cauliflower is incredible! I travel quite a distance to get here and I‚Äôll be back again for sure!

What a glorious find! Food delicious, we had chefs menu, with a selection of 5 curries that they refill if you need or want! The other two stand outs for me were the happiness balls and the cauliflower, amazing. Atmosphere is sort of mesmerising created with pink lights and flowers and the service great. Highly recommend a visit.
Excellent place to dine in. Good food and service. Take the offer and fill your tummy...

Amazing atmosphere, staff were super friendly, and most importantly, the food was amazing. Recently celebrated my third year anniversary with my partner, and honestly couldn't have picked a better place to do so. Highly recommend!
Loved the food! Highly recommend
Always great as usual
Awesome restaurant... can't wait to go back
Delicious feed me menu with a lovely ambience and decorations. Would recommend
Love this restaurant so much. The vibes and the music and the food. Especially that cauliflower dish. SOOOOOO good.
Absolutely love this place. Food is amazing. The lunch thali is my go to and it never disappoints.
I was expecting more considering the pricey items on the menu.
Fantastic service and atmosphere, beautiful fun decor. Cocktails amazing & food just so deliciously tasty.
Delicious meal, with friendly service and overall great value. Definitely dine again!
Food and service was amazing!
Beautifully decorated space. Very tasty food. However we felt that it was overpriced.

The ambience & vibes are 10/10, it has this amazing, homely vibe. The selection of cutleries & plates was very thoughtful. However, the food was a major disappointment. Balls of Happiness were amazing! We had Colonel Tso‚Äôs Cauliflower ‚Äì It was super sour. Tandoori chicken was a joke ‚Äì it was just some grilled tasteless chicken Butter chicken and naan were decent, and Kulfi had a very strong taste of saffron ‚Äì it was so strong it was overpowering the basic flavours of kulfi. The staff was friendly, the service was good, despite being super busy the average wait time for our order was less than 5 mins. I know they brand themselves as ‚ÄúNOT YOUR TYPICAL INDIAN JOINT‚Äù ‚Äì I think that‚Äôs correct as other typical Indian joints have some taste in their food. Prices were very high in comparison to the quality of food received. Would not recommend this place!
The food was Delicious and we felt like the stars of a Bollywood movie. 5 stars for food, drinks and the amazing decor.
Such a unique experience. The food is 5-star and mind blowing but the service staff and sommelier are approachable, friendly and relaxed making the experience all that more special.
Went here for our 2nd anniv dinner & was very happy! Creative set course list ü´∂ and worth the money!! Highlight of the meal would be the pork belly & their snacks!!

We went to dine at Sunda for our anniversary and it was an incredible experience from the beginning to the end. We sat at the bar (highly recommend) and watched the chefs busy themselves in preparing the dishes. Every dish was prepared meticulously and packed full of flavour. We loved how the flavors married themselves between Southeast Asia and Australia. Coming from a Southeast Asian background, the flavors were spot on and reminded us a lot of our mother's cooking. Between us, we shared 12 different dishes! So we left feeling very well-fed. Thanks for the delicious food!
Thanks for an awesome night!

Amazing from beginning to end! My friend and I had a wonderful dinner at Sunda this evening. Each course was beautifully presented and full of flavour. The staff were welcoming and professional. We will definitely dine again!

An amazing dining experience! Loved almost every dish on the set menu, the entrees especially were DELICIOUS. Service was a little iffy at times. We were sitting at our table for about 30 mins with no menus, before a staff member came to check in on us. Seemed like they were a little overwhelmed. However we weren‚Äôt in a rush and they apologized and gave us cocktails on the house! Portions were far more generous than expected, we left feeling very well fed!
Super yum food, excellent service and Awesome experience.A perfect fine dine restaurant.

It doesn't work - better flavour combination from the local chip shop. Over complicated and confused. The barramundi was totally over powered by the orange sauce. The mango ice cream was great, but non of us were getting the grated white chocolate accompaniment. Wine was hugely over priced for what it was too. The only dish that 'worked' from a flavour combination was the chicken. Having read some of the rave reviews we must have had a rogue serving or there's a distinct 'King's new clothes' element going on.

Inventive Adventurous Provocative. One of the best and hottest restaurant in Melbourne. Finger licking Asian inspired food presented in a fine dining setting. The food menu is simply superb and drinks menu huge. Only choice available is a 4 course menu - 4 small starters are fixed and you choose the remaining 3 courses. All 3 courses have wide variety consisting of vegetarian, meat and seafood options. The drinks menu can't be more detailed. A must try would be an understatement for this young chefs restaurant making waves across Melbourne!

Tucked away in an unassuming lane way away from the hustle and bustle busy street of Chinatown is a hidden gem called Sunda. The way they prepare the food is exceptional. Truly an elevated dining experience. Definitely recommend.
Great food and service. Very happy

Just go here!  (You're Welcome)... and trust me on the vegemite roti... even if you don't do vegemite. JDFI! you're welcome ;p One of my very favourite dining experiences of all time. Food is flavourful and intense, balanced and full.  Wine list is equally diverse.  Great for Vegetarians. Share EVERYTHING, and enjoy.
Could not recommend this place highly enough.  The only thing the eclipsed the spectacular food was the sublime service.  Brilliant. Well done Sunda Dining!

3 course tasting menu was great but not mind blowing. Good selection of dishes with each with some Thai flavours. Some of the dishes were a bit unbalanced on the flavour, and had hot food served with cold sauces.  Service was amazing, and nice restaurant decor!
10/10 everything!
I like the idea of fusing several Asian cuisines ie. Japanese, Indonesia and Chinese into one single dish. It's definitely exquisite.

ü•ò southeast asian fusion ü¶Ä otak otak, spanner crab curry ü•ï carrot, macadamia satay, sunflower, kakadu plum ü¶™ oyster, coconut curry vinaigrette üêö raw scallops, asparagus, horseradish, desert lime üçó bannockburn chicken, thai sausage üç≥ soft egg, coconut rice, chicken, baeri caviar üêü humpty doo barramundi, pumpkin üçì tofu rice cream, eucalyptus, summer berries ü•≠ mango sorbet, geraldton wax, passionfruit  üè†: @sunda_dining üìç: Punch Lane, CBD  üìù: Down a city laneway, you'll find Sunda. Experience the ever-changing, intricate menu at Sunda, where Khanh Nguyen's innovative dishes are inspired by the best of Southeast Asian and Australian flavors that is sure to tantalize your taste buds.  ‚ù§Ô∏è: We loved this meal! Our favourite course was the snack, which included four different items that were super innovative and fun to try. I really liked the bite with carrot, macadamia satay, sunflower, kakadu plum. Crispy, creamy, and yum!

I have nothing negative to say about Sunda. visited on valentine's day and we were treated like royalty! walking in and taken upstairs to the beatifully laid out, spacious and industrail style top level, it felt so intimate yet so wide! the service was impeccabl, with staff extra friendly, attentive and thorough/knowledgeable when explaining the menu and each item as it was laid out. the whole vibe of the restaurant is calm, you can tell extra care and thought it put into each dish which you can see the chefs working (seamlessly and neatly) among the kitchen. as for the food..wow! easily some of the best and top food i've had in melbourne, it was really an experience. each item (especially the snacks) were just bursting with flavour, each element purposefully placed and paired perfectly. i loved everything, particularly the barramundi which got tastier as i ate more..somehow?! the egg is so unique, and the simple yet tasty desserts did the perfect job to refresh the palette after such a flavoursome and rich meal. the canele surprise were a delight. I cannot fault a thing. a must visit - perhaps for an extra special occasion and for an absolute adventure for your tastebuds! thankyou Sunda, we felt so special!
Amazing. Plus, we had a voucher, which made it much better. Don't skip the scampi dish!!

What a great dining experience in Melbourne! Like the other reviews have stated, all the snacks were delicious but the oysters are a must. We got the egg noodles as an addition which complimented the barramundi and chicken well. The staff were very friendly and provided excellent service. They also serve a really smooth margarita.
Great food friendly stuff

Im gonna be honest, the food is good, but not my thing, I can tell is good quality products and the flavors are an experience.  I don't know if it's intentional or not... but it took us 2 hours to get all the food, by the end I just wanted to leave without the mains. I don't know if the idea is so people can stay there longer or what, but there is no way I'm coming back, I wouldn't sit and wait 2 hours for any meal in the world... not even a grand slamwich.  The tip is just a joke, $300 between 2 people should be enough to pay salaries. I had to tell 3 different waiters for water because it took them more than 15 min to just get us tap water... this is on a restaurant with more than 10 employees... I have seen restaurants with 4 employees giving better service.  The reason I give 4 stars is because I have this conception that the 2 hour experience is intentional, the food quality is good, but overall this is not my thing at all, wouldn't recommend and can't even begin to understand what kind of people like this experience... if the 2 hours is not an intentional thing, I would probably just give a 3 stars.

Amazing dining experience courtesy of my wife :) the degustation menu was superb, the snacks were amazing and would highly recommend getting the egg Hokkien noodles along with your main dishes. In fact, we hope the noodles get turned into a main - they‚Äôre that goood!
Simply stunning. I‚Äôm not going to give details- just go there and see for yourself

Incredible fine dining experience. Great flavors of south East Asian foods and local Australian cuisine. Oysters were really good as part of appetizer. Highly recommend if you‚Äôre thinking about going there.
The food was sensational, the service excellent and overall a great night.
Great food and service. Will come back again
Favourite thai restaurant in Melbourne. Best Moo Ka Ta in town
A little pricey but the food was delicious and more authentic that your average Thai restaurant.
I will always come back to this place. Everything is delicious.

We went here with a group of 5. The beef sushi was their best dish but they ran out of it. We tried chicken wings, dumplings and noodles. All were ok. The reason for our 3 star rating was this. We asked for the bill and when we went to pay we realised on the bill the price that was written on the menu and what they attempted to charge us differed. When I showed them there was no apology they just amended the bill to the correct price. They had written higher prices on our bill than the actual price that was written on the menu. Motto of the story always check your bill. We won't go back unfortunately.

We came to So Thai because we drove pass and were interested with the restaurant vibe. It wasnt busy, but the staffs made it difficult in choosing the table.. (ex. This & that table is already booked, etc), although we were at the restaurant for 3 hours.. it was still many empty the table. We were put at the front with small table. The food are ok, but can be better. Green curry chicken is full of chicken breast, and the salad size is small. The price is a bit expensive and not worth it. Sorry, I wont be back again.
Nice decor and environment. Food was above average was quite authentic tasting

It‚Äôs a nice restaurant located just opposite Queen Victoria market, so it‚Äôs convenient to have a nice meal here after. There‚Äôs a outside area too, and the inside ambience is very nice.  Food didn‚Äôt take long to come up, it‚Äôs tasty, but a little salty. Only realised that they have ice cream on our way out. Haha! My wife and I stumbled across this beautiful restaurant as we were shopping at QV market. The restaurant is friendly and service is quick and attentive without being in your face. TheMassaman curry was perfectly seasoned and left me wanting more, We are looking forward to returning.

We initially went to Queen Vic Market for the summer night market which we had to abandon as the place was just packed, heaving long cues for food. I was particularly horrified with people carrying food on sticks which can mangle some poor hungry soul‚Äôs eye out.  Anyway, we tried this place which was across the road from Queen Vic. The place was a lot more safer, friendlier, comfortable and no cueing for food. The staffs were friendly, food was generous and well seasoned, but the menu list could do some spruce up as it was tatty.  Anyway, I saw steady trickle of people from the Queen Vic market cross the tram tracks to So Thai. Staffs were very busy that my Tequila sunrise came towards mid of my meal and I have already drank the complementary bottle of water.  Will go back to this place, price reasonable and serving generous.

We‚Äôve been here so many times now and just can‚Äôt get enough! There are constantly new dishes to try + the serving robot is sooo cute.  Our favourite dish was (and will always be) the Pandan Martabak with crushed peanuts & oreo. We would describe this dessert as a sweet crumpet with a rich buttery flavour and fluffy texture. There are a variety of fillings available and right now there is the Valentines Day Special ‚Äì a Red Velvent Martabak with strawberries, Nutella and cheese.  Featured: Kwetiau kuah siram ‚Äì delicious flat noodle topped with thick egg gravy sauce  Sate Padang ‚Äì beef satay with spicy sauce  Nasi Jinggo ‚Äì chicken rice dish served wrapped in a banana leaf (beware extra hot sambal ü•µ)  Es Cendol ‚Äì jelly drink in coconut milk  Kopi Gula Aren ‚Äì coffee drink

good service, yummy dishes.

We were invited to Yoi and my first experience of an Indonesian restaurant has set the benchmark very high. I didn‚Äôt know what to expect but we were blown away. Whilst a casual style eat this family run restaurant had exemplary service and absolutely delicious food.  We were obsessed with the salted egg fries and thoroughly enjoyed the beef rendang, kewtiaw goreng and nasi goreng all of which were extremely flavourful and very generous serves. Exemplary value given the reasonable pricing. Incredibly full we had to try the martabak which is their famous sweet pancake you can stuff with the flavours of your choosing. We went via recommendation of the most popular which is cheese and Nutella. Whilst it sounds like an odd combination it‚Äôs delicious and a must try. Thoroughly recommend  Original review We were gifted a Yoi delivery which was cool as they are one of few city restaurants that seem to offer suburban delivery options. We got to try their new martabak pizza which is an ingenious concept as each slice is a different yummy flavour. I loved the Nutella and m&ms ones best.  We were actually so full from the delicious mains that the dessert was the next days breakfast (and what a fun way to start the day!) and speaking of the mains the teriyaki chicken and beef rendang were super flavoursome and incredibly filling. They certainly impress

Daniyeru's Detailed Review:  Customer Service 5/5 *Very attentive, friendly and professional service from all staff, which is hard to find in establishments. So well done on this part! Water was also very attended to as j as very thirsty this day! (hangover). If you're lucky, you will get a robot to bring out the dish to you! (I was not lucky, got humans. Darn..)  Food 4.5/5 *The croquettes were definitely a 5/5! You must absolutely try these home made savoury croquettes. Simply heaven in a crowuette! *Rendang with Rice was nice! It felt like it was missing something, perhaps extra condiments, egg, chilli on side but it lacked this extra element to it which kept it at a 4/5. Product quality wise though, it was on point. Soft tender beef pieces, but should need a rework on the recipe to achieve that missing punch needed! * *  Value 5/5 *Each main dish was approximately $16. For the friendly service you get, the great tasting menu items, the robot and clean venue, its completely worth it!  Atmosphere 5/5 *Modern, very clean establishment. No faults.  Overall *I would definitely come back as it is an open, very friendly vibed restaurant with cool concepts in place. I will definitely return for the croquettes and try more of their menu!

First taste of Indonesian fusion food. I'm thinking my Nasi Bungkus was more traditional, served wrapped in banana leaf with steaming rice, squid rings, red and green chilli, slow cooked beef rendang and silver beet. Really fragrant and a great mix of flavours. It was spicy and built up to be fairly spicy by the end but so good. Squid rings were tender and good bite size pieces. The beef was lovely. And the sauces that seeped into the rice brought the dish together. Well balanced.  The beef satay skewers were yummy. The only dish that was a let down was the fried chicken on rice. It was a good sized piece but was very rich with the mayo, a struggle to finish.  Staff were excellent and very attentive. It was cool when the robot rolled into the table to serve food.  Overall, a great experience.

The worst crumbed eggplant I have ever had. 4 paper thin slices of eggplant that is probably older that I am covered in a thick chewy doughy "crumb" that tastes like chewy sand. Absolutely horrible I would give it less than 1 star is possible. Do not pay to come here.

Really sad to make this review as I'm the most positive foody usually. Do NOT order the pork belly entree. It's tiny, cold and takes over 30 mins to arrive. Don't be surprised if the 3 tables who arrived after you get their mains before you get your entree'. Steaks were tasty, but my 300g fillet was about 250g (I'm experienced at this) and my partner's was about 200g with a 50g bone. The main issue was wanting to discuss the disappointing entree and lag time of service with the staff. Waitress offered fresh entree and extra wine. Then she said chef refused the fresh entree. We asked to speak to him, but after 20 mins he didn't show. I entered the kitchen to let him know how impressed I was and that there was going to be no payment for the meal. A little professional courtesy goes a long way. I truly hope you have a better experience. I think the waitress was actually on charge!

Lots of Malaysian local workers came here for lunch and ordered their rice dishes during our visit.

Haven't had it in a while and was really disappointed today. As soon as the plane returned to Melbourne in the morning, I made a special trip to wait for it to open for breakfast. My friend and I went in as soon as the door opened with our large and small luggage. The waiter arranged a seat for two people. Since we were carrying luggage, I asked for a seat for four people. Unexpectedly, the waiter told me that it would take three to four people to sit. I said that it was just opened and there was no one. Why can't people sit? She said: There will be a lot of people waiting. I was speechless, and wanted to say that if there were not many seats left during the meal, of course I would not have such a request, but it just opened (11am) and there were only three of us and another bachelor. Later, we were given a four-seater seat, but we were already in a bad mood. Later, I ordered a curry laksa and nasi lemak, I believe I will not eat it again. While the curry laksa was ok, the eggplant was obviously overcooked (blackened). The nasi lemak was really not good at all.

Daniyeru's Detailed Review:  Customer Service 5/5 *Greeted politely by waitress. Not authentic like when you are in Japan where they welcome all customers with a Irrashaimase! But in Australian standards, good enough!  Food 3/5 *Truffle Pork Ramen: Was very average and it was about $25. I can't comment much for this as even Instant packet ramen had more flavour. Let alone the extremely steep price. Real ramen like in Japan is 400% cheaper, fresher and tastier. I wouldn't recommend and just go elsewhere for a good ramen, not here. Maybe if you are drunk as this place apparently opens 24 hours I think. Might be good when your taste buds have beer goggles on. * * *  Value 2/5 *$25 for a truffle ramen was completely not worth it when compared to the taste (or more like lack of taste)  Atmosphere 5/5 *Judt like in Japan, counter style and Japanese theme. I do really like the set up here though! Good for dates/mates  Overall *Would come here for a drinking / casual date, but would not come here for a culinary experience. Definitely not! But would be cool for a date as they have strong 196 cans.

Would‚Äôve given 5 stars but my son had severe allergy hours after we had dinner at home. Lucky it wasn‚Äôt life threatening for him but it was still not a pleasant experience.  He ordered the Signature Ramen with pork, he didn‚Äôt finish it so had leftovers to take home.  Today we tasted his ramen and can clearly tell the broth has prawn or crayfish as ingredients. I believe this is what triggered his allergy badly last night.  I just want Parco Ramen to clarify if these ingredients are included in the pork ramen? If so, it needs to be noted clearly on the menu as it could be life threatening for someone with major allergy issues. One of favorite places and visited more frequently prior pandemic...I wanted to give better rating if only*******  Cause of my previous response, our office decided to book the place and I absolutely seconded the thought and we got it through. Excited to share the same experience with my office team, we went there on 09/12/22 and we had my office team there from approx 2-4 pm......  One thing that I love the most there is the service and atmosphere, which is spot on, friendly staff, accommodate requests, absolute essence of hospitality can be seen from the time you interact with staff there.....  But the massive opportunity for improvement comes with FOOD.....in particularly Korean fried chicken burger.... Quality good, choice of ingredients good as well.... however portion control is so high that I literally was hungry after having this chicken burger along with handful of chips...... Understand the rising prices for ingredients but so has the menu items also getting dearer, which I'm okay to pay with but atleast don't have such a tight hand on size of meals that your patrons after having couple of drinks and burger with chips still go out hungry spending $50++ .  Can I please suggest the head chef and management to start acting on the feedback as the intent of this review is to see them doing better, back on the same way Pre-Covid as review of similar nature is popping up again and again , must have meaning.... Cheers

Joomak is a small hidden gem tucked in the basement of a building in CBD Melbourne. I love the atmosphere and the food were really good! I especially love their chicken gizzard and makgeolli. I love going to Joomak. It‚Äôs absolutely affordable and tasty.  The chicken giblets here is a must order. The vibe is perfect to have some drinks with your friends. I would definitely recommend to get a booking on weekends as it gets busier.  My favourite Go-to here in Melbourne. I don‚Äôt think anywhere else is as affordable as Joomak is!

Service and staff are appalling (more specifically, the short, chubby non-Korean woman)! We walked in with an hour and a half until closing (still time for food) and saw two booths free; however, we were told that they would not seat my party of two. After having to wait and then be able to ask why, the waiter still said a flat no and it would be 30mins to an hour wait with no hesitation. They were not accomodating nor friendly and simply refused to help. There was such a lack of customer service that it has turned me off Joomak for good!

Walked in with 1.5hrs to go. We didn't even acknowledged. Had to wave the short chubby non Korean lady down before. 3 booths opened up as we came in. She said they were for 4 or more people. Just said she wouldn't seat us. I asked if they were expecting exactly 4 people in the next 1.5hrs. Rather than accept 2 people who were hungry and willing to pay. Got turned away. Blatenly didn't care and zero customer service. With all the hype I've heard about this. This was my first and last experience with you. I'll take my money to the much better rated Korean places in town thanks

came here after a theater and it was 11pm. glad that this place still opened for business at the late hours. didn't expect their noodle soup to be that good. the noodles were cooked perfectly and the soup were delicious. they offer a great variety of soup, from non spicy pumpkin seafood or pork broth to different level of spicy hot soup. the staff were all very friendly considering its late and they could be tired from the whole day working. we enjoyed our meal and will certainly be back.

When I told the staff about the bone, she just smiled and said sorry about that. She was too busy to bother. There was only one staff serving the entire restaurant, long wait despite we wrote our own order and handed to the waitress. We left hungry despite paying $110 for 3, we didn‚Äôt bother to order more and went to the shanghai restaurant next door. My brother felt bad for taking me here.

Like the decor reminds me of trips to Japan, let down by staff who do not want to be there, turning customers away way before specified closing time, and the mixing of sake into one bottle was a bit rich and the food was okay would I go back, not really.

Nice atmosphere, quick customer service and quick food. Although the menu says there are izakaya days and normal menu days, they weren't doing skewers at the time, so I was told.  Miso was good, eel was alright, tempura was alright and mochi seems nice actually.

I arrived at 8:25pm and when I reached the front of the queue with my partner at 9:30pm the staff came out and, realizing people behind us had one more person in their group, admitted them and left us standing at the front. She might have said "sorry, we will serve you next" but they didn't communicate with us. It was a cold night and to be waiting at the front knowing the restaurant will close in an hour and see the people behind you be admitted was a little frustrating. When we were admitted we were in a rush to order and eat, I was seated near the kitchen and at one point the staff walked out and dropped a plate on my shirt onto the floor, it wasn't a smash and she was fine, but I had to check my shirt for spills and she didn't say "sorry" or "excuse me". This type of thing almost never bothers me but it stood out because I was on edge about the service.  Despite the poor service the food and drinks were fantastic. An explanation of the small serving sizes would have helped as I only had one order but the tori no tatsutaage and umeshu cocktails in particular were delicious. It had an authentic izakaya feel and comfortable atmosphere but better service is definitely needed.

Authentic foods with authentic settings!  Tried to visit this place about a year or two ago but was closed. This time, came across this place again and decided to give it a try.  We came here around 5pm and the tables started to fill up. The place isn't that big so I suggest to come early otherwise you may have to queue.  We ordered their banquet no.3 and the foods were very delicious. There were 8 courses including the appetizers, main, and desserts.  The salmon sashimi was very fresh and the nabe soup was very memorable! They put the chicken balls and the taste was like dumpling fillings.  The set was very good choice especially during cold weather. It warmed up or body and soul.  Will definitely come back next time to try other dishes.

Dine in and spent ~$150 for 2 adults. We came here because of good review in google review and the pictures are appealing. First thing first, you have to use QR code to order food. Scan in using the QR code, only realise the menu is in Chinese ONLY! so for those who knows no mandarin, its impossible to order anything. My partner know no mandarin, he gave up and I placed the order (thankfully I know mandarin) Secondly, we would like to order the hot pot meal set for 2... viewing the hot pot meal set menu, All SOLD OUT! Nevermind, we came here, and tea already served,so we ordered the soup base and meat separately.  End up ordered a soup base, 3 types of beef and marinated prawns(raw). The verdict- the meat offered not great. The sliced beef is very grainy and chewy, the brisket is very tough. The soup base came with few slices of corn is tasty , but we are thirsty after wards. Then for the sauces, have to pay $3 per head.  summarizing my thoughts: The soup is good but it should be good given that its $39 with few slices of corn and daikon and meat balls. raw marinated prawn- first time trying it. acquire taste, not my cup  of tea but its ok . $29 for 8 prawns the meat - below average - given i spent ~$70. I am expecting better than average. The service- they are attentive and at least when I asked for their assistance, they are trying their best to assist. But, if you are are non Chinese speaker or literate, its going to be so hard to even navigate the menu.

This is an interesting place. I was a bit late, as they close at 3 PM and reopen at 5, so I was curtly reminded by the receptionist about it. Nonetheless, I ordered a bowl of Beef Rice Noodle Soup ($21), which arrived soon. For the price, the quantity was very good, but I wasn't entirely satisfied. It was somewhere between a Chinese beef noodle soup and Vietnamese pho. The flavour was kinda uneven, and I could smell something a little sour, from the excessive veggies or soup, I can't say for sure. The beef wasn't bad but mediocre  The place is well lit, simple and clean. Plus, you can take some candies from the reception.  Not recommended in my opinion.

TLDR: Go to the one across of Emporium instead of this one. Horrible staff attitude.  Long story: Waited 20 min in line and got to the front just to be told "we don't have table for one, sorry" and they turned me away. Staff then went and asked the next party in line "for how many people?". So I asked to clarify "you don't have seats for one person?" And they told me they only have booths for 4. (The party behind don't have everyone ready yet). I told them I'm only gonna take 15 min. A counter seating then opened up (lucky I waited). While I was having my meal they were talking about me in Japanese to each other right behind me on why I was so mad. Well to answer you: I was turned away for waiting in line for 20 min without being ask to wait for a counter seat to open. Don't talk about your customer in Japanese literally behind them assuming they won't understand. Quality was better in the other branch anyway.

A cosy diner that serves up all-day breakfast, coffee and sandwiches. They‚Äôve got your classic pancakes, breakfast muffins as well as specialty sandwiches. It was so good that we actually visited twice in one week because we wanted to experience their breakfast and lunch.  The breakfast muffin was top notch. It was like a fancier maccas muffin but 100x better. The cheese toastie was the best cheese toastie I have ever had. It paired so well with the tomato dipping sauce. The pancakes were so light, buttery fluffy! Especially with that pecan butter!  For lunch, you gotta try their sandwiches. I‚Äôm a huge tuna melt gal and saw there was a not tuna melt and had to try it. The salmon in it was amazing! The deli sandwich was so fresh and kinda reminded me of a banh mi. The bread for me though was on the harder side and ruined the insides of my mouth. The hot dawg with the thai sausage was shockingly good and surprising! It was like a thai curry stuffed in a sauce and it was balanced with the sauerkraut BUT the sausage to bread ratio was really off. There was too much bread for my liking and not enough sausage.
I‚Äôve been thinking about this sausage muffin and caesar salad for WEEKS ü§© outrageously good and like no other!!! The thick slices of bacon are devilish!! üòà

Excellent food and will be back. Usually these aesthetically pleasing new cafes are a bit gimmicky but the food was great. The English muffin was so fresh and fluffy and all the ingredients seemed fresh and homemade. The burger was good with a fluffy bun. The pancakes were good but not the best.

Because it is located in an alley, there is a lot less noise from the city. This store adopts American retro preppy style with red soft decoration, everything looks so cute. My boyfriend and I each ordered oatmeal fruit yogurt and fried chicken burger. The food was mediocre for us (that's probably why I gave it a 3), but otherwise there were almost no faults. If you and your friends want to have a good breakfast time, this is the place to choose!

Really had some delicious food from this restaurant. I had takeaway so can't comment on the dining experience. But I can comment on the food! Prior to Covid 19 I came across this restaurant when I was craving for jajangmyeon ( black bean noodles) and it was mind blowing. Service was friendly and servicing of the food was very massive.  Went back today to try it again and had to wait a long time to be seated. No one came to check on people waiting outside in the cold. Had the black bean noodle  and sweet and sour pork sirloin and it was very average. The batter on the pork sirloin was very bland and the sweet and sour sauce which came at the side was very sweet and nothing sour. Believe me serving was massive but taste wise very disappointing.  Black bean noodle tasted nothing like before and if anything very sweet and filled with onion. I rather go for something small and nice.  Honestly I would give 1 star  for today but considering I did had a good experience couple of years ago keeping it to 3.

I returned after a few years. The sweet and sour pork is still so delicious and there is a lot of it. They say the batter is thick, but in fact, I don't think this is authentic sweet and sour pork. These days, sweet and sour pork with glutinous rice is fried thinly, but I think all Chinese restaurants in the neighborhood used to do this. It's been a while since I ate so deliciously. Opposite Queen Victoria Markets lies @HelloJose_Au for some Mexican fare. The hand pressed tacos looked appealing so got: - slow cooked beef, chipotle cream, pickled cabbage, chilli - beer battered fish, spiced up cream, pickled cabbage  A golden brown light super crispy batter encases perfectly cooked tender fish served along with a pickled cabbage. Very enjoyable particularly with a squeeze of lime.  The slow cooked beef is super tender and full of beef flavour, very tasty but needed a dash more seasoning. I like the Jalapenos which deliver a but of kick and background chilli hum. The corn tacos are also very enjoyable. Good size tacos with a range of hot sauces at the table, complimentary popcorn, Mexican themed chilled environment, lovely dinner, solid offering. Probably need to work on adding a salsa for that burst of freshness typical of a taco.  #MexicanFood #tacos #beerbatteredfish #slowcookedbeef #slaw #corntacos #foodie #melbournecbd #melbournefood @zomatomelb

Was really excited to come try Hello Jos√© after driving past for years. All I can say is I‚Äôm disappointed with the experience.  We ordered the corn, totopos, ceviche tostadas, then a mix of tacos.  Ceviche was mostly missing, with only a few tiny pieces of fish on guacamole and an undercooked tostada, the corn was underwhelming with more mayo than any other topping.  Tacos took more than 45 minutes to come out after ordering. So be prepared to wait if you do come. There are better Mexican places (Mamasita or Hotel Jesus)in my opinion with higher quality ingredients.  After reading some of the other negative reviews I‚Äôm shocked to see how the owner has responded. I‚Äôd give this place a miss the disappointing experience is not worth the cost.

Don‚Äôt come if you‚Äôre in a rush‚Ä¶. Got a roast pork banh mi takeaway.. It was good with crispy crackling and decent fillings. FANTASTIC BANH MI.  This place has some of the best value for money, tasty and carefully prepared food at Victoria Market!!  Great Vegetarian & Tofu Options.  Friendly and attentive customer service  Really Good!!

Conveniently located at one end of the Queen Vic Market. We tried the beef and chicken pho. The pho comes with a huge plate of veggies which is typically Vietnamese. The pho was tasty and we found the portion large. In Singapore yes we would pay more than a couple of dollars less but for half the portion. The avocado and mango shakes were so good value.

Absolutely LOVE this spot in Queen Victoria‚Äôs Market. The mussel pot is a must have! Especially on a chilly morning! The mussels will warm you right up and help you start your day. I highly recommend trying the grilled garlic butter and breadcrumbs mussels or the steamed Chilli mussels, both which I really enjoyed. This place is definitely my Saturday mornings stop from now on!

The wait is too long, we waited nearly one hour to get food. Stood 45 mins until we can order, the line didn‚Äôt look like that long but it was surprisingly slow. The cashier also overcharged us by $10, hopefully it was just because of mathematical error? (It was simple calculation though) we ask for $10 refund and got it back. The food was nice but definitely not worth the wait.

The best mussels in town! Definitely worth the queue. A must try. The mussels are very fresh and they have a variety of flavours as to how you want it cooked. My personal favourite is the chilli coconut cream then comes the steamed blue cheese.

So interesting small van restaurants üíï. The foods is all about Mussel. Good stop for you after long walking Queen Victoria market. Want to try again for other tastes. I was have Coconut chili So good üòä. Lovely two of owner, gentle Women. Beautiful smile üíï
Fantastic!

We really love going back here and always order the chilli coconut cream. Perfect for the chilly days. The mussels are cooked fresh and the soup goes really well with the bread.  Be prepared for the long lines though but it‚Äôs really worth it. It‚Äôs ran by a nice couple so best be patient with them. Will always be coming back here and might try the bleu cheese one next time.

Haven't stopped dreaming of coming back to this place lol  Best $13 of 2023 so far!  Be prepared to line up for a hit but it's worth it!!  Come early to make sure they don't sell out on you. Mine were the 4th last serving but that was at 3pm.

Been hanging for some Belgian style mussels pot. So tried this little outfit in QVM and they did not disappoint. Valued at $15 per pot. One pot is looking roughly about 400 to 450 grams, and served with 2 slices of bread. Variety of flavours available, ie: - classic white wine with option to add cream, - chilli coconut cream - tomato & chilli - creamy blue cheese - red wine, tomato, & chilli. Tried the first three flavours mentioned above, and must say the chilli coconut cream was the best out of the 3. Mussels were fresh, plump, and juicy. Queue was quite long, so be ready to wait a bit.
Yummm Chili Coconut Cream is the best!!!

Worth every second of wait. Ask for extra bread pay a bit more. You‚Äôll thank me later

These mussels have just earned my award for the BEST dish at the QVM. If you are looking for super speeding service and scoffing down something in your break, this ain‚Äôt your place. The two ladies tucked away in the ‚Äúshell‚Äù shaped van work hard, but are limited on space, so when you finally get your order every bite is worth it. So slow down, choose a favourite and get chatting to those persons that are eagerly awaiting. Game changer.

After reading the reviews we headed to the Vic Market to experience some yummy mussels. This was our experience. We ordered popular one on the menu with coconut cream & chilli, they were very tasty however the other "steamed white wine, garlic & parsley" were bland and tasteless. They were fresh but couldn't get any flavours, the liquid in the bowl was from the mussels. On their white board menu it reads as steamed white mussels but if you want the onion & cream you have to specify & it's extra however on their printed board menu it has a photo of them advertised steamed white wine mussels $15 - which is what we saw & thought we were getting! We didn't enjoy them at all & when we asked the lady said "you didn't ask for the cream & shallots" - well, it's not what their printed menu advertises. The tables were dirty & it wasn't a busy time. We asked for a napkin to wipe them down.

I recently visited this mussel place and was impressed with the quality of their freshly cooked mussels. I appreciated that the mussels were cleaned and had the beards removed, which made them easy to eat. The prices were also quite reasonable. Overall, I had a great experience and would recommend this place to anyone looking for delicious and affordable mussels.

I saw a long queue at this food truck at QVM and decided to join the queue to settle my lunch. The store is run by a lovely couple and they only selected the good quality mussel in the dishes they serve. Had the coconut cream steamed mussels which came with probably around 12 big sized mussel with 2 slices of bread which taste really great when dipped in the sauce. The coconut cream's taste is quite strong and I truly enjoyed it!

Located inside victoria market, they have the best mussels ever! Besides the popular menu, we tried grilled mussels too and it was soo delicious. Highly recommended!

Just right there in the temporary fruit n vege section.  Ordered a pot of  Steamed White Wine mussels.   Since it is made to order, there is a short wait. One of the best mussels place in Melbourne. Located right at Queen Victoria market along the small vegetable stalls. A mussel like shaped store with teny tiny chairs and tables around for sitting, with small flower pot around the bench. This has been one of my favourite go to for mussels for the past 4 years. Weekend gets busier and so during the weekdays. Over the years, the   service and taste remained the same if anything, better than so many other places. Every time I go there I always order the chilli mussels hot hot hot üî• as I like it that way and Mr. Mussels makes it with a bright smile.  They also have cheese and coconut and other options, which are fairly good. Good food and  amazing ambience üëè  Will definitely recommend this if you are visiting Queen Victoria Marlet.

Extremely rude service by a male staff. Had to ask for a receipt and given one only after the thlrd time as i stood there waiting for one. He was trying to laugh it away. Been coming here for years so thought best I drop a review. Great value lunch which is increasingly hard to come by in the area. The owners and their workers always have a smile for you and will make you laugh. The chilli wings are the bomb. Lightning fast service.

I've never ever been here to this 21st century version but I do remember this eatery although the version I remember is vastly different and very basic to this newer version?! The version that I remember from over 29 years ago might or might not be the same franchise or it's seriously upgraded from what I remember it from 1989/90?! From what I remember as a kid, this place was owned by the son of the opposite Drago's eatery. He opened up this place up off the success of Drago's selling nothing but exclusively roasted barbecued/charcoaled chicken, think that he might of sold fresh range whole chicken as well to customers as well?!..It did okay but nothing like Drago's which I think the son hoped to emulate through the success of the fathers original franchise entrance next door. Now's there this newer variant which I'm not sure if it's still owned by the son of the father via Dragos (probably not now?!). It's so different to what I remember but this version looks like a success now then what it used to be?! If this place is still somewhat owned by the son of father's Drago's franchise?! Then out of respect to him?! I give him 5 stars because when the father wasn't around when myself and my mom came to Drago's?! He treated us real well, especially my late mother so kudos to him! I think that may of seen the son of Drago's still managing the original store but not the Corner Chicken Shop (don't remember the original franchise name before this?!)?! But out of respect to the Drago's original owner of this store when he did/if he does manage this place now?! 5 stars!!!!!  Update: 2022! I recently just went to Drago's out off curiosity (didn't order anything) on a Sunday and I found Corner Chicken Shop (opposite the entrance) to be fully closed up and empty!!!?! Like the stall was vacant or something?! Please tell me that you haven't closed up the shop after 33+ years here?!...Just want to confirmation here cheers...

Came to Soul Soul purely for the bottemless brunch and I had a few things to add  PROS  The cafe is beautiful with a quite and lovely ambience, the staff were helpful and attentive and their cocktails taste great!  CONS  They seem to have made a few adjustments, in my opinion. Everything was completely different from how it had been advertised on social media.  Arrived¬†at 2:30 p.m. and told I was there for the bottomless brunch. I was given a seat and the menu till the staff arrived and said they stop serving the bottomless brunch at 12 or 12.30 ish? This is no where to be found¬†on their website. Although the staffs said they would be pleased to serve me till the cafe closed, this did have an effect on the orders.  THE DRINKS  There were few alternatives for ordering drinks, especially cocktails. I had seen many people on TikTok come for the bottomless brunch and order margaritas or even pina coladas, but when I arrived, there were few options available.  There was little effort made into the beverages when they were served; there were no decorations; they were simply mixed and placed in glasses. I was unable to get the final cocktail on the menu as I was told that the drinks machine was shut off. Overall, it was confusing and disappointing.  THE FOOD  I order the cold noodles, and while the presentation is stunning, the flavour is very bland. I thought I was having a salad. Since it was Easter, I paid a total of $90 for one person (the holiday rate was $11). And, to be completely honest it was definitely not worth the price.  Overall, my experience wasn't terrible, but it didn't go as I had hoped. I'll give it another try next time.
Great coffee and super friendly staff

I‚Äôm always so unsure whether I get a savoury and be sensible or go crazy and get a sweet dish. When I saw the French Toast here, temptation took over and wow. As you can see from the photo it‚Äôs visually stunning. It had a lot of flavour and great texture so I was very pleased with my decision. I also got an iced matcha which was also very yummy. The food is expensive and service took forever to deliver scrambled eggs on toast with mushrooms - forty minutes after ordering when the rest of the table had finished their meal. A pot of tea is $6 with an extra $1 for milk. With so many great cafes in Melbourne, I wouldn't recommend this one.

The bottomless brunch at Soul Soul costs $79 and includes one main dish from the brunch menu, one serving of fries, and unlimited alcohol, including cocktails, red, white, sparkling, and ros√©. The bottomless brunch has five cocktail options. Cocktails are around $20 each, if ordered indiviudally, so it's recommended for those who can drink three or more cocktails choose the bottomless option. The coconut latte cocktail is delicious and tastes just like a coconut latte. The Baileys used in the drink balances well with the thick coconut milk, and the alcohol flavor is not too strong. The espresso martini has a very milky taste surprisingly, which is different from my understanding of an espresso martini, but it tastes good, just wishing that the alcohol flavor could be a little stronger. Pink Soul is a watermelon juice cocktail, and Cranberry Fizz is a cranberry-flavored cocktail. These two cocktails definitely have more alchohol in them as compared with the coconut latte and espresso martini, because you'll feel a bit tipsy after drinking them. Aperol spirit has a standard taste. The seafood soba is beautifully plated and includes shrimp, smoked salmon, and scallops. The buckwheat noodles paired with yuzu soy sauce are quite refreshing, and appetizing. The soft-shell crab sliders are very generous in portion size, my friend struggled to even finish one, it was very filling. The soft-shell crab is perfectly fried. The complimentary fries were tasty.

Great brunch options! Loved the fried mushrooms so ordered it twice and signature mocktail and smoothie was extremely refreshing for a hot summer day  We came back today after a year and loved the new Ago Veggie option served!
Worst brunch place ever been! Food presentation in a mess, salad not fresh! BAD COFFEE!

Some people can eat first and pay later, we can't.  3 The design of the space is unreasonable, there are two of the 4 seats, but during the hour and a half of my meal, there were 2 and 2 people. Is it so difficult for you to change the 4-seater seat into a 2-seater?  4 The kitchen is unprofessional. I ordered two bowls of noodles, but only one was served. You are so careless and want us to pay first? Does it fit?  I don't know what the boss thinks, but I feel that he is a good cook but has no management ability at all.

The spicy beef noodles was pungent, without a doubt. The spice was numbing, Sichuan style. If you enjoy this then go for broke and order this.  The noodle with tomato, pork, egg, veggies and chilli was the tastier dish. The flavours were more balanced with the right amount of spice. The noodles were bouncy and had a good texture.  The seating process was not the best  given the restaurant itself is quite small. Expect a wait during busy times.

This should be the kind of place you can go for an efficient and tasty feed when you're hungry and don't want to spend over $20 for a meal, right? This was my (I think fair!) assumption given their vibe and reviews. I like service to be quick and to the point but this was blunt, rude, and quite petty honestly. At first, they promptly came to my table and demanded payment immediately after I ordered via the QR code. I didn't think too much of this at the time despite how abrupt it was, but in hindsight it speaks to how money-focused the owners are, and how little they care about the customer experience. Then they told me that I couldn't buy my dish by itself because it was under $20 and I was paying by card. Not even that I needed to add a 50c surcharge, that I straight up needed to buy something else or I couldn't have that dish because it was too cheap. Being really hungry, I added a $10 dish. When I asked for a takeaway container, considering all the food I now had, the waiter insisted on a 50c cost, and then a 50c surcharge for paying by card. Definitely won't be back here. Stingy owners and service, and absolutely ridiculous to not accept card.
nice delicious
so so underrated, 3-in-1 is a must-try
Amazing noodles!
The food was bland. they were rude as and tried to over-charge me for a can of coke (sneaky) They also have a picture of dictator Xi jinping in the wall üëé Would never come here again

I don't know how to do business, many people than me have finished eating and left, and my package has not arrived for a long time. While saying that they are all served in order and serving the next dine-in first, it is really speechless, and I will never go again.

I went during the store celebration and experienced a ceiling of poor service reviews. At the time of checkout, three people ate 299.99, and two coupons were given for more than 300. The little brother at the checkout resolutely refuses to give it. You have to buy extra things to make up more than 300. I said what is the difference between 299.99 and 300? Can you find the boss? He resolutely refused to find a manager on the grounds that finding a boss would affect his performance, so he froze. It's really a gem, and every penny depends on the face of the waiter. The worst one I have eaten in Australia so far, the only gimmick is the face-changing show.  Thanks for the reply, I hope it‚Äôs best to find out before replying, I was 290 or 299.99 that day. If you spend 290, you will not ask or post. I think it's outrageous to be short of a penny, and that's not how business is done. I didn‚Äôt give a lottery for a penny, and then I ordered another bottle of coconut water for the lottery, and told me that I couldn‚Äôt swipe my credit card if I spent less than 10 yuan, and then I couldn‚Äôt buy any more because I had already paid the bill at the beginning, so I still kept it. Looking at the 299.99 ticket, I bought three bottles of coconut juice before I got the ticket for the second lottery draw. I just complained that your business idea is really outrageous, and your reply was even more outrageous. If 299.99 does not give me a second chance to draw a lottery, I should be informed a moment before I pay, and let me choose whether to buy something to make up 300. Instead of asking me to swipe the card in a hurry, and then spread my hands and tell me that this is not OK, that is not OK. By the way, go and see your posters and promotions yourself, that day was the second lottery draw for 300, not 350, can you even make it up? Open your eyes and talk nonsense

Panda Hotpot in Melbourne is a must-visit restaurant for a unique dining experience. The Sichuan Mala hot pot is delicious, and the world-class design creates an incredible atmosphere reminiscent of a Chinese period movie.  There are combo set for 2,3 and 4 person , reasonable price , meal are included soft serve ice cream.  Highly recommended!

I don't like to leave a bad review but we ordered the most mild signature soup and it was INEDIBLY SPICY. There was a 5mm layer of red chilli oil on top and we counted 25 VERY HOT dried chillies. The service, sauce range, menu items etc were all good, but our meal was COMPLETELY ruined because all items had to be cooked in the soup that was inedible. (I have reasonable tolerance to chilli, having traveled all through north and south Asia, India etc and never found anything as spicy as this "very mild" hot pot).
My partner and I where throwing mix thoughts for hot pot in general. All we‚Äôll say is glad we chose hot pot did not disappoint

Went there for lunch today with a group of friends. the special lunch set is a real bargain. We had a group of 5 plus an one year old baby - we ordered the $139 set for 4 people and added additional dishes. The bill was at $43 per head for quality food and drinks, and we all ended up extremely full!  We really enjoyed the good hypes there - used to come here quite often pre COVID, will def be back again.  NB: - their ‚Äúextra mild‚Äù is quite spicy already as this is authentic Sichuan hotpot - it‚Äôs equivalent to Medium spicy in the other restaurants! - Got to try their new ‚ÄúSquashed juice‚Äù, which you can smash it by yourself, or ask the waiter to do it for you. It‚Äôs quite fun to watch, and the juice is amazing to ease the spiciness (life saver for hotpot!)  And thanks for the amazing food, keep it on :)

This place needs to do better. Some of the food is decent (emphasis on some), but the service is dreadful. Inattentive staff, poor customer service, regularly confusion with orders going to  wrong tables, staff asking customers to repeat and clarify their orders long after they've paid and waited - all of these things have happened without fail on every occasion if have dined in over the last few years.  Recently I had lunch with my partner, she ordered the Bun Bo Hue (BBH) and it was honestly putrid. I remember not enjoying it myself last year but this was something else. Feedback was immediately provided quietly and without causing a scene.  No more than 2-3 spoons of broth were consumed.  While settling the bill the manager refused to take any responsibility, pinning the blame on our palates (my partner is Caucasian - little did she know that I am of Vietnamese heritage and an avid BBH lover - as is my partner who also lived in VN for 3+ years. No apology, remedy, replacement, or refund was offered.  If your food is so bad it is outright rejected and barely touched, AND you are notified immediately... the wrong thing to do as a business is to do nothing at all. Simply not good enough.  Pains me to pin a negative review on a small business but I've been an infrequent customer for a few years and they need the criticism - especially after in person feedback was outright rejected.

They have a variety of different cuts to choose from pork, beef, chicken, and even some seafood options too. For each table, you‚Äôll also get complimentary corn cheese, fried chicken wings, your choice of soup (we chose kimchi tofu) and 4 different side dishes (refillable!) Little Africa Restaurant in Melbourne is a hidden gem for anyone seeking a truly authentic Eritrean culinary experience. The daily platter for two is a fantastic introduction to the cuisine, offering a variety of dishes that are bursting with flavor and texture. Each bite is a journey into the rich cultural heritage of Eritrea, from the tender and juicy lamb to the aromatic and delicately spiced lentils.  Arguably one of the best things that I've had the pleasure of shoving into my mouth orifices, the platter comes with injera, a traditional Ethiopian and Eritrean sourdough flatbread that is soft and spongy, perfect for soaking up the delicious stews and sauces. While deceiving at first glance, portions are extremely generous, we had the daily platter for three people but it could easily feed four, making it an excellent value for money.  The restaurant itself exudes warmth and hospitality, with the friendly and attentive staff adding to the overall experience. The ambiance is cozy and inviting, creating a sense of comfort that makes you feel right at home. Overall, Little Africa Restaurant is a must-visit for anyone looking for an authentic and delicious Eritrean dining experience.

If you haven‚Äôt tried Chickilia, please do and support them.
