Without a doubt the best HSP in the city. Ended up going two nights in a row.  Serving sizes are reasonable and generous. The large is a large (2x burger box), none of this round container of sadness BS, they‚Äôll even wrap it in foil for you, a surprising benefit as the cheese properly melts by the time you get it home.  Meat to chips ratio is exactly what you want. The chips are correctly salted and crispy and the meat is similar to what you get at other places but they actually cook it properly and it comes out juicy and tender. Oh, and they don‚Äôt charge extra for cheese, because that would be sociopathic.  The star is absolutely the garlic sauce though. It‚Äôs obvious they make it themselves and it‚Äôs a damn good recipe, light, refreshing and tangy, cuts through the heft perfectly.  If I were to sum it up, it‚Äôs all the ingredients you know and love, but it‚Äôs prepared and arranged perfectly which makes it the best. If it were up to me, his would be the HSP specimen I would choose to put in the royal archives.

Confessions of a Takeaway Addict: Late-Night Scrolling Only Leads Me Back to This Kebab Shop  As a takeaway addict, I have spent more time than I'd like to admit exploring the world of fast-food options. In the wee hours of the night, I often find myself scrolling through UberEats, searching for the perfect late-night snack. But in the end, I always come back to this unbeatable kebab shop.  Believe it or not, there's another kebab shop just a minute's walk away from where I live. But when it comes to quality and consistency, this place has them beat, hands down. I've ordered the mixed kebab combo more times than I can count, and the quality has never wavered.  Oh and the chippies! These babies are crispy, golden nuggets of potato goodness that have the competition beat. Perfectly seasoned and made from fresh potatoes, their chips always arrive hot and crispy, which is more than I can say for the other kebab shop's chips that are sometimes not so fresh, dampening the overall eating experience. In the great chip showdown, this kebab joint's chips come out on top almost every time.  The service is truly outstanding. The staff have even left notes expressing their gratitude for our support, recognising us as regulars. Their attention to detail is evident in the way the food is packaged ‚Äì the chip box is not sealed shut, ensuring the chips stay hot and crispy without getting soggy, and the drinks are placed on the side to avoid contact with the rest of the food, keeping everything as warm as possible.  Whatever your reason may be, if you ever need some late-night sustenance, do yourselves a favour and give this place a try ‚Äì even if there's another option closer to home ;)
Such a wonderful experience!!! From the moment we arrive the staff were lovely. Food delicious üòã Definitely I will come back again! ‚Ä¶

The Halal Snack Pack (HSP) was truly a masterpiece, and arguably one of the best things that I've had the pleasure of shoving into my mouth orifices. For those unfamiliar, a Halal Snack Pack is a popular Australian dish that consists of hot chips (fries) topped with marinated meat, usually chicken or lamb, and covered in a variety of sauces. I recommend getting BBQ, chili and garlic. Never skip the garlic.  $20 for a large size which is a lil pricey, but its a ton of food.  The staff were friendly and welcoming, and the atmosphere was cozy and inviting. The prices were also reasonable for the quality and quantity of food provided.  Overall, I would highly recommend Kebab Connection to anyone in the mood for some fantastic Turkish food.

The wok charred skills from the chef in Nahm Tao is the top 3 for me not just in Melbourne but in many cities I visited.  Me and my wife had been here for more than 10 visits and the chef never failed once.  We had these 3 on each visit: 1. Pad See Ew with beef The flat rice noodles are perfectly executed, the veggies are crunchy, and full of wok charred aroma and heat.  2. Chilli Basil stir fry with chicken As above without the noodles  3. Thai fried rice with prawns The Thai fried rice we had last night (Sat night) was 10 out of 10.  My wife is a very picky foodie and she never went back to any chinese restaurants that are supposed to have this wok charred as their basic skill set, thus most of their dishes are too oily, once again, it's not limited to Melbourne.  This is just our observations but I think it's worthwhile to share.

Yeonga is a Melbourne institution that has been running strong for several years. I've had mixed feelings over the years, but fortunately experiencing more pleasant visits recently. The service has improved dramatically ‚Äî everyone is attentive and lovely. Service is üíØ üíØ üíØ  Between four adults, we ordered: -  "A Yeonga Odyssey" set which had LA Galbi (ribs), pork belly x 2, wagyu chuck eye steak, and scallop x 4. It also came with a full size budae jjigae (army stew). - Seafood pancake - Yukke (Korean beef tartare) - Extra rice - Soju x 2  Meat was super fresh and marinade was fragrant when cooked on the charcoal grill. Upstairs was well ventilated. Highly recommend making a booking before you visit as it can get really busy. Cash discount.

First - If I could allocate stars to their soju flavour selection, it would be a 0. Only had peach, yoghurt and original.  Admittedly I have not been Yeonga for quite sometime, but always recommended them as they were one of the better restaurants to have BBQ in Melbourne. Meat quality remains very good, and their add ons of corn cheese, rice cake and I believe it was fish cake is well welcomed.  What lacked was the quality of service. They had a 2hr maximum seating but found that the staff were very slow in cooking the meat and often if not taken care of by the guests on table, would be left burnt.  This has definitely diminished the overall relaxed BBQ experience expected in most Melbourne places.  Lastly back to the drinks. I would recommend them offering a tap beer and adding more flavours to their soju.  This place is busy, but honestly there are alot of other great BBQ places around stepping up. 3 star.

Best first time Korean BBQ experience, my first dry off  Korean BBQ and it was a blast. Fresh, good taste and best service. üëå don't go next door to the Korean BBQ try this here. Friendly and good quality üëå  loving it, highly recommended.  Do yourself a favor and try it out ‚Ä¶

You guys, don‚Äôt sleep on this spot! Sister to @yeongabbq is a new KBBQ restaurant called Hwadam Korean BBQ and grill. They‚Äôve been around for a year-ish, but they‚Äôre a little hidden - located on the end of Elizabeth St, on the 2nd level of an apartment complex.  The restaurant itself is very chic with cozy booths that resemble traditional Korean houses. It‚Äôs also super clean and modern where all the ordering is done on an iPad that‚Äôs attached to your table. The staff are incredibly attentive, proactively refilling our sides throughout the night and cooking all the meats for us. They were so friendly and speedy - legit felt like they were running to get our sides and water refills.  Between 3, we ordered: ü•© - Wagyu Combo Set [$119] - included wagyu chuck eye steak, oyster blade & bulgogi, sushi rice, halloumi cheese and mushrooms - good quality meats, and a generous amount for 3 üç≤ - Beef Soybean Stew [$17] - very beefy and hearty üêô - Seafood Pancake [$22] - their pancakes slaps! It‚Äôs one of the best seafood pancakes I‚Äôve had! Crispy and loaded with ingredients. It smelt soooo good when they brought it out ü¶ê - Soy Marinated Raw Prawns [$26] - the prawns were super fresh, buttery and marinated so well! üåΩ - Corn Cheese [$14] - cheesy with a slight crisp from the sizzling plate - so yum! üçö - Steamed Rice [3.8] - because the set came with sushi rice, you could probably share a bowl between 2  Definitely recommend checking it out the next time you're in the city for KBBQ! Follow me on Instagram @ EvelineEats for more food content and reviews x

Their service was terrible and unreliable!!  My friend and I came during lunch hour, and the service was awful SLOW! Upon arrival, there was no one to assist us, either it be to be seated or how/where to order. They also did not provide a receipt (except when you request for it firmly) , and it‚Äôs very easy to confuse yourself with what you ordered since the names of their dishes are difficult to remember. When they serve the food, they placed one dish in front of us and we had to wait for another 30mins before the next dish is served, and this was after repeatedly asking them for our food. Great atmosphere, and to be honest, great food. However, second time here and second time disappointed with a couple of things. Whilst I know this is supposed to be cafe concept, the price for a normal plate of nasi or pan mee is alot higher than your conventional malaysian restaurant. That wasn't the problem, my problem is the amount of sambal they gave for the nasi lemak. It is probably 1 tablespoon at most and any Malaysian would have agreed this is wayyyyy too little. We asked for more sambal but they charged us 3aud extra for another tablespoonful (on a little saucer) of it. $3?? Really?? I don't think I am being too brutal but if you were to get this amount of sambal in Malaysia or even Melbourne, would you even go back to that stall?? Another issue I have is the lack of vegetarian options. Needless to say, we weren't that happy and will probably not return. I usually don't write any reviews but this really left us reeling and I have to put it out there and hopefully the owner sees this and be a little bit more generous with their sambal for their future customers.

I had an absolutely fantastic experience dining at this Malaysian restaurant located between Melbourne University and Victoria Market. The spacious seating and beautiful decor provided the perfect atmosphere for enjoying the delicious food.  I ordered their specials-only dish- Hakka noodles which was mixed with pork mince pieces, and it did not disappoint. The noodles had the right amount of springiness and their crispy fried chicken also had a unique vinegar taste that made it stand out. This dish also reminded me of Sarawak style kolok mee. I also ordered a simple sunny side up egg on toast with a side of bacon, and it was a simple breakfast dish cooked to perfection. The edges of the egg were crispy and the bacon was nicely fried and charred. Overall, I highly recommend this restaurant for anyone who is looking for authentic and tasty Malaysian cuisine. If you're around the area, it's definitely worth a visit.

A caf√© that offers a select number of Malaysian dishes at prices that are above the norm.  Nasi Istimewa is just Nasi Lemak with a fancier name (Istimewa means special). I ordered the beef rendang version ($22) - the platter also has rice, crackers, bean sprouts, cucumbers, egg and sambal (chili & spice paste). For me, what makes a really good Nasi Lemak is the sambal. It has to be said that the sambal is really good - well spiced, with enough chilli heat to excite the palate but does not overwhelm. The rendang is good - thick nutty sauce with meltingly tender meat. I missed having anchovies with my nasi lemak (which costs $2 extra).  The Hakka noodle ($19) is plainer looking. Mince pork with noodles and a lonesome stuffed beancurd on the side. Hakka is a ethnic group in China that has its own distinct dialect, culture and cuisine. If you have eaten -"chow mien", then you have eaten Hakka noodles, except that the version here is served in a broth. The noodles is really good - smooth and "slurp-able",  goes really well with the pickled green chilli.  Beancurd stuffed with pork/fish is a common Hakka dish. My mum used to get pork meat and "pound" it with the back of a Chinese cleaver until it is "sticky". She also includes the Hakka's secret ingredient - salted fish. The taste when steamed or pan fried is smooth, bouncy, sweet and salty. The version here - the meat taste rough and too salty for me.  I went on a Saturday - so everything costs 10% extra.

Orange juice is nice and fresh! I had the vegetarian pesto pasta really aesthetic experience! I wanted to study there but could not concentrate cause the music was a little bit loud, but still is a nice place to have brunch or lunch with friends!

I cannot recommend this place enough if you're in the mood for some delicious and affordable hot pot. They have incredible variety of fresh ingredients available. Whether you're a fan of seafood, meat, or vegetables, there is something for everyone. I particularly love the range of options for soup base or flavour - you can customise your hot pot to suit your taste preferences perfectly. My favourites are the spicy soup, Curry and Malaban.  And let's not forget about the skewers - they are out of this world! The meat is incredibly tender and flavourful, and they are the perfect accompaniment to your hot pot meal.  The staff is incredibly friendly and attentive, always making sure that your needs are met and your experience is as enjoyable as possible.  Overall, I would highly recommend this hot pot restaurant to anyone looking for a delicious hot pot and exceptional service. It is absolutely one of my favourite spots to dine.

Upon entering Bobbie Peels, the first thing that struck me was the atmosphere. The venue is dark and moody, with great lighting that sets the perfect tone for a night out. The design of the bar is spot on, with a cozy and inviting vibe that immediately draws you in.  As for the food, I had the carbonara and it was pretty good. The menu is extensive and there's something for everyone. My friends also enjoyed their meals, and we all left satisfied.  One highlight of the night was the Victorian whiskey that I was recommended. It was peaty and complex, with a depth of flavor that really impressed me. I would definitely recommend giving it a try if you're a fan of whiskey.  All in all, Bobbie Peels is a great spot for a night out. The food is good, the drinks are even better, and the atmosphere is spot on. If you're in the mood for a cozy and laid-back evening, this is the place to be.

Great place to taste authentic north-Indian flavors. They have a wide variety of veg and non-veg Indian curries to choose from. Their Kadhai paneer/palak paneer or the daal are must-try items if you're looking for veg options. For the meat items, butter chicken and lamb rogan josh are just yum!  But if you want to score a bang for the buck, I'd recommend the veg/meat-lovers thali, which will be served with three different curries with rice and a butter naan.  Owners are very friendly and welcoming.  Additionally, all the meat dishes are halal.

For a small place like this, the device really isn't necessary in my humble opinion, as the friendly service complements the food well and brings people back.  Ordered the thali meals with a selection of curries(I wish they'd list which curries are available to choose from, and if I want the more expensive options then just say +$2 or whatever as an add on). The mango lassi is thick and yoghurty, delicious.

Popped in for KBBQ - the food was tasty, the beer was cold, but had noisy kids in the restaurant.  If it wasn‚Äôt for the family sitting next to us, in a 25% full restaurant this place would‚Äôve been five stars. The food was delicious come out we got a mix of beef and pork set. There‚Äôs a lot of competition for Korean barbecue in the area and this place is probably as good as any other.  I have Kloud beer, which isn‚Äôt available in most Korean barbecue restaurants so that was a plus. I just would‚Äôve hoped that the staff or the parents would‚Äôve asked the kids to be a little quieter.  Probably a good place to go. If you‚Äôve got a family, maybe not the singles .

BBQ Brothers 10 is easily one of my top favourite k-bbq places. They have the kindest and most accommodating staff! Food quality is spot on and pretty affordable including the drinks. Been here twice now and the quality remains the same. Will definitely be back!
Closes its doors for customers at 130pm; closing hours listed as 230pm.

A perfect meal for any occasion!  What particularly stood out here was the impeccable service. From the moment we walked in we were greeted to a vibrant, aesthetically pleasing atmosphere by friendly staff, then seated and given great insights to the menu.  We ordered the younger brother ($74). The meat was absolutely delicious, incredibly tender and each bite just melted in your mouth. The vast array of complimentary dishes ensured that we were exposed to as much of what the restaurant had to offer - not just mouth watering food but a complex culture as well! Throughout the dining experience staff were once again friendly, attentive and proactive - we didn't have to budge yet the meat turned out perfectly juicy and tender.  The condiments made by the restaurant were a cherry on top to the already delicious food, elevating the flavour greatly. There were options suited for all taste buds with sweet and spicy sauces.  Drinks were beautifully crafted and presented, creating a magical dining experience.  Highest compliments to all the staff for the work you do, and to the BBQ Brothers who have truly accomplished something amazing!
Great food and service. But the air ventilation system are poor. After we finished dinner, our clothes and hair smell badly.

Undoubtedly one of the best Korean bbq experiences I‚Äôve ever had. The servers, chefs and workers there were so kind hearted, caring and were the ones who made the experience a complete dream! The food was absolutely delicious, so authentic, the quality was outstanding and incredibly filling - hats off to the chefs there and honestly, I couldn‚Äôt have asked for a more food enriching experience! I highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a great food night out - this place is the one!

Meat could have been cooked a bit more so the fat renders. Nothing good about eating medium rare with chewy fatty bits.  Disappointed with the gas stove. Was expecting charcoal, would have gone elsewhere if had known this prior.  No sesame oil or even salt. No soybean paste or red pepper paste.

Why have I not tried KBBQ sooner? If you haven‚Äôt, I highly suggest you do and start off at @dancingflamemelbourne to kick off your KBBQ experience. @dancingflamemelbourne offers Chinese & Korean fusion cuisine which is Influenced by the restaurants of Northeast/Manchuria China and Korea.  What we ate:  ü•© Diced Mayura Wagyu M8 ü•© Seasoned Angus beef brisket ü•ì Pork Belly üåΩ Cheese & Corn üçú Cold Noodle w/Pork üçó Sweet & Spicy Chicken ü•ó North-Eastern Style Sweet & Spicy Salad üçö Steamed Rice  Our review:  Can‚Äôt beat melt-in-the-mouth, tender M8 Mayura Wagyu, but the Seasoned Angus Beef Brisket combined with the Korean style sauces, spices and fluffy steamed rice was also a highlight.  A Hibachi style grill made the experience so much more exciting and finishing the cooking of the meat infused a beautiful charcoal flavour.  The North-Eastern Style Sweet & Spicy Salad & the Cold Noodle w/Pork was a lovely refreshing addition to the meal, with the North Eastern salad being top tier. I did however find that the Corn Cheese would be best served on a grilled plate as being cooked on top of the grill didn‚Äôt give that satisfying melty bubbly cheese top. I also would have preferred the Pork Belly diced. The Sweet & Spicy Chicken was really tasty and moreish.  If you‚Äôre looking for a more interactive & intriguing dining experience, then I highly recommend checking out @dancingflamemelbourne  Thank you @dancingflamemelbourne for having us. üíì

I recently visited this restaurant and unfortunately had a very disappointing experience. Firstly, the quality of the meat was not up to standard as it was not fresh and seemed to be frozen. The meat also had a sour taste which made it difficult to enjoy.  In addition, the sauces provided were overly salty and did not enhance the flavor of the dishes. The service was also very slow, and it took a long time for our food to arrive.  The corn cheese was a major letdown as the cheese did not even melt properly and the overall quality was very poor. The taste was average and the cheese was hard to chew.  The stone pot rice had an excess amount of water and the egg was overcooked, which made it less appetizing. Overall, the experience was very disappointing, and I would not recommend this restaurant to others.

Korean Chinese charcoal BBQ place just stone throw north of Queen Vic Market. They have options of wagyu platters and Korean-inspired dishes such as seafood and kimchi soup. Good exhaust hood system too so we didn‚Äôt find ourselves and our clothes in smoky perfume. Kind staff.  Check out our reel on Instagram @melbournefoodtravel

I‚Äôve always  enjoyed AYCE BBQ. My partner and I have always eaten AYCE as we eat SO much. However you can definitely tell the quality difference.  What we ordered:  ‚≠êÔ∏è SUPER SET: Wagyu & beef plate, seafood plate, veggies, kimchi, corn cheese, lettuce and beef ‚≠êÔ∏è Pork belly ‚≠êÔ∏è Mixed veggies (zucchini, pineapple & Cabbage)  The seafood set comes with calamari, scallops, prawns & mussels. The wagyu is bloody amazing üëå it just melts in your mouth and taste so tender. The marinade is also delicious and sweet and the salt provided pairs so well with it. I cannot fault the feed just absolutely amazing.  The scallops were also the highlight. They took a while to cook evenly but other than that these were my favourites.
we had a really lovely meal here having the best of both worlds - chinese & korean food üòç We recommend the wagyu beef plate. The calamari fried rice was also really flavorful ‚Ä¶

DOESN‚ÄôT WORTH even half of the price. I don‚Äôt usually write a review, even if the food is not that good. BUT this restaurant definitely DOES NOT worth 4.6stars. Good food, albeit on the slightly more expensive side. The meal can be considered a light Japanese meal that fills one just right.  The atmosphere at lunch is like a cafe. Music can be hit or miss. Food was very tasty. Great selection and variety of sides with good balance of flavours. Had to take 1 star off as service was lacking. I stood waiting to be seated for over 10 minutes. A number of staff noticed me but ignored me. My understanding was that the hostess was preoccupied but to be treated like I was invisible wasn't pleasant. A simple greeting to acknowledge my presence and to let me know to wait a little would've been enough.

Bad service. Went there waited for 20+ minutes and the waitress only just asked us to wait and did not give us an estimated wait time when asked by us. Also, she did not ask us to provide our names for walk in reservation while others who came after us get to be seated before us. She had only ask us for our names for walk-in reservations after we confronted her about the long wait time.

High quality food and service! The meal sets are absolutely delicious and come with a wonderful range of side dishes. My friends and I are all very satisfied with our dining experience  :-)

One of my favourite places for teishoku. The food is delicious and the service is great.  It is always full so you should reserve through their website especially for bigger parties. They have a credit card deposit per person for reservations.  They have a huge variety of sides served with your chosen main and I always look forward to them.  As I have a dietary restriction, they always offer to swap one of the side dishes instead of just excluding it which I greatly appreciate. You have to bring it up when ordering though, just mentioning it in your booking is not enough.

Remember to book your table because they get soooo busy during lunch time and there can be a very long queue. Food is delicious and I love the variety in the teishokus. The price is higher than average bentos and combo meals, but I'll say it really worth the price. If you're the kind of person who likes having side dishes, soup, fresh seafood and dessert all-in-one go (or if you like fancy plating), you'll fall in love with this place! Just be aware as they are very busy, they could be rushing to collect the dishes when you're almost done, keep an eye on any unfinished food especially the dessert. üòÇüòÇ Will definitely come back for dinner next time.

We love pork cutlet and it was thick and juicy. I forget to take a photo of thickness of cutlet, because it was too yummy üòãb. I can‚Äôt control myself üòÖüòÑI hope that they keep the quality of pork cutlet. ‚Ä¶

One of the best Japanese restaurants I‚Äôve been to in Melbourne, booking is essential, but worth the wait if you haven‚Äôt booked.  Service is great and options were plentiful too, but we decided on the miso salmon, which was cooked to perfection.  Sides were good too with lots of choice, was very satisfied after finishing the meal.
Good variety of sides while you only have to pick your main. Bit pricey considering each side is not too hard to make (wife's words). Easy lunch though, despite not the best value.

I am thrilled to share with you my extremely positive experience at Mercadante restaurant. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with warm and friendly smiles by the staff who quickly seated me at a cozy table.  As I perused the menu, I couldn't resist ordering the spaghetti puttanesca, and I was absolutely blown away by how perfectly cooked it was. The sauce had just the right amount of spice and flavor to make each bite an explosion of taste in my mouth.  For dessert, I decided to try the tiramisu, which was absolutely delicious. The layers of creamy mascarpone cheese and perfectly soaked ladyfingers were expertly balanced, making each bite a true delight. And to top it off, the espresso was brewed to perfection, making for a perfect end to the meal.  But what really made my experience at Mercadante stand out was the exceptional service. The waitress was attentive and lovely, always making sure I had everything I needed to fully enjoy my meal.  Overall, I can confidently say that Mercadante is a must-visit restaurant for anyone looking for an exceptional Italian dining experience. The food, service, and atmosphere all exceeded my expectations and I cannot wait to go back for another meal.

I‚Äôm not one to usually leave a review but the man behind the counter (assuming the owner) is extremely rude, dismissive and unprofessional. We ended up walking out without ordering because of his poor attitude. If you do not want to serve certain minority groups then kindly close your doors.

The owner (i assumed it was the owner) really needs to change his attitude. I felt treated disrespectful from beginning to leaving.  You guys dont really have to read the whole text but for those who are interested ill describe the whole experience:  1. First things first: I came inside with a smile and said hello - i barely got one back, just a grumpy face from owner and his wife I assume.  2. I ordered a chicken kebab and the next customer a lamb kebab. He started cutting the lamb kebab first which is surely ok to me. He took most of them and got it ready for the other guys kebab. Since he hasnt started cutting the chicken kebab yet I asked if I could try a little bit of the lamb kebab to see if I would order a lamb kebab instead (again, he hasnt started working on my food yet so it definitely wasnt too late to ask). He just respomded with a short *no you cant* in a rude tone, not even looking at me.  3. I was slightely surprised and explained him briefly (i usually dont eat lamb, would order a lamb kebab if i like it, i would be happy to pay for the piece i try...). Again he said something like *we dont do that* and really just walked away. I finally ordered a chicken kebab.  4. The kebab itself was very tasty eventhough i had to eat it off the tissue because it fell apart several times and for 18 AUD I was also surprised to get such a small kebab. I didnt complain about the size because I was pretty sure what response I would have been given . Also I was surprized he just added all the vegetables without me asking, so I found myself picking out the onions which is not too bad (and yes i could have said something while he was adding the veggies but i didnt see him doing that since i dont stare at him working for minutes)  5. I was a bit upset but thought maybe its because i asked about a small lamb piece to try, so I pulled myself together, smiled, said thank you and goodbye, Im not even sure if he responded eventhough he clearly heared that while looking at me.  Honestly, this whole experience was questionable. I really dont get why Im the first person mentioning this bad service in the reviews. In case i did upset him with the lamb question im sorry about that but even before I asked about that his hospitality/service was not good. Whatever reasons it were, business owners nowadays need to keep professional. If he does that to other people as well, his business wont survive for long. What a bummer since the (small and expensive) kebab itself is tasty. Because of the good taste i cant give 1 star.

AWFUL CUSTOMER SERVICE. DONT EAT HERE. The owners of this place are VERY selective with who they provide good customer service too. What do you want?‚Äù whilst he rushed us. We felt very uncomfortable and confused as too where his aggression toward us was coming from because prior to our interaction, he was serving another customer who he had a completely different attitude towards. He was kind and patient with this customer. We decided to leave and said thanks, whilst walking out, the owner made unnecessary comments towards us suggesting he was happy to see us go, stating ‚Äúyeaaah I thought so‚Äù whilst shaking his head and looking at us up and down. 15/4/23 After my excellent experiences with this cafe in 2021, brought a group of 10 there for dinner. Sadly, although the food is still excellent, the customer service has deteoriated to abysmal. The lovely proprietor Julie wasn't there and the staff were very reluctant to inform me when I can speak to her. I had booked a table for 10 on 11/4. I spoke to Yenny and told her specifically that we want to sit outdoors. I made sure she understood my request by making her repeat back to me my request for an outdoor table. When we arrived a table was reserved for us indoors. I proceeded to speak to a middle aged woman staff who kept insisting we sit inside which to me is terrible customer service. I demanded to speak to Yenny who then agreed that we had a booking for 10 for an outside table and set it up there and then. Customers shouldn't be forced to sit indoors when they had specifically requested to sit outdoors.We then ordered our dishes together. However, the dishes came out very slowly with some at the table being served before others. I also noticed that those who came later than us got their meals served before us. That is so unacceptable. I had to confront Yenny again to request for our meals. I have eaten at many cafes and this is about one of the worst experience of being served in this manner. I asked when I  could speak to the lovely proprietor Julie but was told she will not be available on Sunday as she is at church and is not around on weekdays. I am shocked at the almost non existent customer service and the deterioration of this cafe like this. Thankfully the food is still nice or I would have downgraded this cafe's rating to 1 star.  6/2021Excellent chendol, excellent satay and rice cakes at D'Penyetz & D'Chendol. Reminiscent of my great grandmother's home cooking.Absolutely love this place. Very friendly and good service. Nothing is too hard for them. The proprietor has a smile and remembers the customer's names. This place is a gem.
Good food

Smashed chicken wiht green chillis was great! The chicken satay sticks were god. Fried fish with chillis was a dissapointment, fish was not crispy, was very soggy and the sauce lacked punch. Service was not the best from the elderly lady.

I had lunch here today, and I ordered the Iga Bakar Kecap (lit. soy sauce grilled (beef) ribs) which came with sambal and little salad and 2 pieces of fried tofu with plain white rice (Nasi Putih) ($19.60). The place was bustling with people but the receptionist was kind enough to suggest me dishes and so I chose this one. I've to say, it was just so good! The sauce and seasoning was on point, the meat grilled just right and the portions were much more than I was expecting! The food didn't take long to arrive. My seat was a tad smelly, maybe because I was close to the kitchen area or the place was small with many people dunno which, but once the food arrived everything else disappearedüòÅ. I'm definitely going to visit this place again, hopefully with my friends and try out the other dishes.
Authentic Indonesian Ayam Penyet! Best one I've had in Melbourne. The beef ribs (Iga Bakar) was amazing as well. Be sure to get in early or call to book a seat, they fill up very quickly.

Excellent Indonesian food but management please employ at least 1 more person in fronthouse. The girl serving us is unfriendly, not even acknowledging us when walking in. This is possibly due to overwork, with only two front house staffs looking after the entire indoor and outdoor dining area.

always a beautiful experience at marion, these pictures are from my most recent visit, which is nice to experience a changing menu. service is always faultless, kind and extremely informative of the wine/food. attentive and friendly also. wine list is impressive and carefully selected. peppers were quite spicy and pretty average tasting, probably wouldnt get again. but everything else was impeccable as always! some of the lushest kingfish i've tried in melb not overpowdered by acidity. beetroot salad was a delight. fries are always a must - and the tiramisu, however has been served smaller and smaller with every visit! thankyou marion for your beautiful hospitality. the perfect spot to sip on wine, snack, and people watch.

Based on my personal experience on a Saturday night, I can only rate it 2 stars for the following 3 reasons:  1. Food quality & flavor: appetizers were almost above average, mains were bland mostly, the juices were awfully watery and tasteless.  2. Service quality: I wouldn‚Äôt say they were under staffed but having two trainees on a Saturday results in negative customer experience, orders took quite sometime to arrive and table service was below average.  3. Overall experience: food quality combined with two trainees working on a Saturday and slow customer service translates into below average experience.  Suggestions:  1. Elevate the cuisine and ensure to enforce better food quality and flavors. 2. Better train staff and ensure staffing at max one trainee on a Saturday to improve the overall customer experience. 3. Present a better management for the entire venue, the whole place seemed run chaotically.  Lastly, this is outright directed at the management and not staff level (chefs, waiters, runners) because they only execute, but it‚Äôs managements sole responsibility to oversee that execution and enforce better quality or at the least educate staff to individually supervise and take a more supervisory approach in their way of work.  Bottom line: management needs an overhaul.
Not a good customer service, very poor presentation on the table. won‚Äôt go there again.

We had an iftar buffet yesterday and I must say the atmosphere was absolutely bizarre.  They booked too many people without considering the amount of space they had. You had to wait in a long queue to get your turn which was really frustrating for the elderly people.  The walking space between tables was narrow.  In the end, there was a shameless person who was breaking the queue wearing chain in blue dress and acting like a godfather. But I wouldn't say it was management's fault.  In the end, the food was good but the service and atmosphere was bizarre. Think twice if U will bring elderly people with you.
Great food, Great Ambience, Great Service. Manager Sadiq & his entire team were very accomodating for my event. Highly Recommend!

We made an online booking for my wife's 40th birthday dinner.  Only when we arrived were we told that the ala carte menu would not be available and only the buffet would be available because it was ramadan.  We looked at the buffet and we're not impressed as we really wanted to be able to order from the ala carte menu but this would mean we would have to wait over 1 hour until the other carte menu would become available.  They did apologise for the confusion and blamed their online booking system. (not good enough!)  For the sake of a quick phone call they could have called us to advise that the time we booked would not allow the ala carte menu and avoided ruining our dinner plans for my wife's special night.  Really disappointed! üòî

Never ever recommended  A ridiculously disgusting place that anybody would ever imagine.  Customer service : horrible and very poor. Short staff always compromises the quality of the service which was quite evident in this restaurant.  Food quality : below average and we witnessed how it was cooked with rush and very less attention to the taste and quality of the food  Environment:  very tiny and no room to move around the tables. People were bumping into each other with no whatsoever privacy in their tables and sitting areas. It looked more like a college cafeteria.  The food was not enough and the plates were dirty with water leaking a around them. They didn‚Äôt even bother to dry up the plates ‚Ä¶ really disgusting  Our experience:  My family and I booked the Iftar Buffet ( Break Fast - Dinner ) Over the phone we were told 55 per head but when we reached to the restaurant they charged us more. Further to that , for Iftar, it is really important to have the food ready to be served right on time ( approximately 6pm that day ) to be served straightaway however, the dinning area was not even ready by that time. All the guest with their little ones had to be directed to a waiting area on a first floor mezzanine with a dangerous stair case. The allocated waiting area was also freezing which the families were clearly not comfortable at all. Later on when the guests were directed to down stairs to sit on their tables, the food was not yet ready‚Ä¶. Staff were rushing around . Regardless the food was also significant delayed and then once the serving began the buffet area was so tiny and never enough for that number of people at all. For instance one little soup pot was allocated for that many people ‚Ä¶ you imagine ‚Ä¶it wasted a good 15 minutes of everybody‚Äôs time for a small bowl of soup. The bowls were just washed with leaking water around them. You should have technically closed your eyes on their cleanliness otherwise you would have walked out starving ‚Ä¶  The dessert options were very limited and there was a tasteless ice tea and a disgusting whatsoever Turkish coffee ( no where near Turkish coffee ) was served  The very first time ever I could have seen that my little ones rejected the chips ( French fries ) was in this place. When I asked my child why don‚Äôt you eat your chips ‚Ä¶ they are gross and slurpy ‚Ä¶ he replied  The resentments and unhappiness was quite visible on people‚Äôs face.  Over all it was a disgusting place and never worth it for the money we paid and the time we wasted in there. A once off experience which will never ever happen again.

We went to this restaurant on Ramdan and they had an open buffet, We were very excited to enjoy a delicious meal, but what we experienced was far from what I had expected. The food was undeniably scrumptious, but the atmosphere was terrible. The place was incredibly cramped, making it impossible to move around without constantly bumping into other diners. To add insult to injury, the whole second floor of the restaurant was left empty and unused.  When I finally made it to the buffet table after waiting in line for over 15 minutes, I discovered that many of the dishes were already empty, and the staff seemed to be taking their time to refill them. Once I finally got my food, it was cold, unappetizing, and unenjoyable.  As if that wasn't bad enough, I witnessed other diners freely helping themselves to drinks from the fridge, so I decided to do the same. However, after finishing ten bottles, I was told that I had to pay for all the drinks I had taken, even though there was no signage or indication that there was a charge for drinks.  we left the restaurant feeling extremely disappointed and angry that I had wasted my time and money on such a poorly-managed and unenjoyable dining experience.  Do not come here for Ramdan open buffet.

A daylight robbery given that it was almost $40 (not even half a chicken).  Spending $150+ for two people and still getting hungry.  Avoid if you can unless you go to drink sakes or want to empty your wallet.

Indifferent to the sushi hand rolls you can get from Sushi Jiro. Absolutely bonkers to think you can charge those exorbitant prices for very average unmemorable food, especially in a food city like Melbourne. What a little gem hidden upstairs of the popular Japanese bento/dessert place, Hareruya. Apparently the owner/founder of Leonie Upstairs is also behind the cafe 279 and Le Bajo Milkbar.  This place serves a variety of small Japanese nibbles including takowasa, karaage, ebi mayo, etc. They also make to order different types of maki sushi which are also fantastic.  The beverage menu is extensive and features never ending list of sake and other Japanese drinks including high ball, umeshu, and so on.  With minimalistic, wooden and warm interior decor (as is typically the case with many Japanese places), the staff are also highly professional, polite and full of knowledge. Louie, in particular, took a good care of us and I'd like to praise him for his service.

My friend and I came by to try some of sake from their extensive drinks menu. They also offer flights of 3 different sake that explore offerings of particular styles, regions or breweries. The staff are very friendly and knowledgeable about the selection of sake available; Nathan, Sean and Ryan were particularly lovely. The place is small, cozy and the vibe is fantastic, perfect for a couple of drinks.

i'm from sydney and came with my friends with high expectations after hearing about it from tiktok and the expensive prices. happy to say that it did not disappoint! i feel that the service really made our night, as the male server was super friendly and enthusiastically spoke to us when explaining the intro to sake float. the food was amazing as well and we all thoroughly enjoyed the chawanmushi and hand rolls. i walked out with a full belly and more knowledge on sake which was great! can't wait to be back.

The sake and snacks here are unreal! Leonie has an incredibly thoughtful and extensive sake menu, and extremely knowledgable staff to take you through it all. The snacks are so good, I always go back for the temaki and blue cheese cake.

ORDERED: üêü‚Äã Saba miso pate: miso mackerel, ginger, onion, cheese, pie pastry üç≥‚Äã Chawanmushi: egg, salmon roe, eel, prawn, scallop, yuzu, beans, carrot, beans, chestnut, shiitake  üç£ Hokkai Temaki: salmon + roe, scallop tartar, yuzu koji ($20.00) üç£ Engawa Temaki: flounder fin, yuzu kosho, spring onion ($16.00) üç£ Kani Temaki: softshell crab, crab miso, curry mayo and greens ($16.00)  ‚Äã‚Äãüç∂‚Äã Fruit Liqueur Flight: Umenoyado Ringo Apple, Amabuki Apollon Blood Orange & Kzaemon Shiroku Junmai Kabosu  REVIEW: From the fantastic mind that brought us 279, Le Bajo Milkbar and Hareruya pantry comes Leonie Upstairs.  With its strong Japanese background, Leonie offers something new. Hand rolled sushi was only familiar to me from cheaper joints (like Sushi Hotaru) which is the point of focus for this dine in experience. From the Temaki selection, I really enjoyed the Hokkai Temaki. Every bite delivered a burst of fish roe and creamy salmon slices which kept things delicious and memorable. There's a certain unparalleled taste when it comes to simple food. On the other hand, this is the most loaded chawanmushi I've ever had. There's a lot going on, and I'm spoilt for choice with every bite. Still silky, it's definitely worth getting. Combined with an interesting and very affordable option to try sake, it's definitely a unique experience to hit Melbourne's dining scene.  Shout out to Nathan, who provided the best service!  However, there were some elements which didn't make this a 5: 1. Counter seating is too low. It was nice to know the faces behind the production of my Temaki, but found that the partition was too high/ seats were too low where I couldn't see the magic behind the scenes. Was let down by this. 2. Temaki had too much rice for the price tag that it puts out. Would've expected more of the dishes which made it unique to be front and centre, or if possible, even bigger handrolls. 3. The pie pastry with the pate is an interesting concept. The miso mackerel is a delicious pate but gets overwhelmed by the buttery-ness of the pastry. Would suggest a plainer/simpler bread instead, to really let the pate shine through. Pie pastry was great on its own though!

Creative and yummy Japanese inspired flavours! Everything is good, but highly recommend the Genmaicha (comes with black sugar drizzle and embedded bits of tiny mochi). The calpis and pineapple is refreshing, with very strong notes of üçç ‚Ä¶

Hands down one of the best matcha ice cream I have ever had outside of Japan!  I was visiting my cousin's family for a few days on holiday and she talked about this place a couple times. We made our way into central Melbourne one night after some dinner and so glad we did because the strong matcha ice cream was honestly incredible!  The queue was extremely long presumably because of how popular and well-known this shop is and I noticed that it's basically only Asians queueing so I knew it would be authentic.  We waited for approximately 30 minutes and the staff members were so patient and friendly with us while my niece and nephew tried out different flavours before deciding which ones to go for. A shout-out to the staff who gave them stickers while we waited for our ice cream to be ready, really appreciated that!  The strong matcha flavour was so rich and strong indeed as the name suggested and I thoroughly enjoyed it. My family also enjoyed the pineapple and calpico flavour, for some reason the two flavours really worked and it was so refreshing!  If I ever do come back to Melbourne, I will for sure visit this place again.

If I could have any dish in the world, it would be a chicken parma from the Universal Restaurant, Carlton, before new management had completely ruined the experience. The $16.90 delicacy was an integral symbol of Melburnian culture: with dozens of people willing to line up every night for a taste of this sovereign panacea.  Served on a plate the size and shape of Captain Cook's vessel, this fat piece of golden breaded goodness laid on top of beer-battered chips as well as herbs and vegetables imported directly from the home of the parma, Italy.  The first bite of this bonne bouche is indescribable. Friends of mine and fellow parma enjoyers have related it to the innocence of their first love; reminiscent of a time before responsibility, a time before evil had established its presence in our world. As the melted cheese and tomato sauce penetrates the top of your tastebuds, the chicken cooked to perfect and the breadcrumbs launch an unwavering assault on the rest of your mouth, resulting in an intangible emotions of pure bliss taking over your body. Each bite of the meal evokes a fresh tenderness: almost as if Italy herself was embodied every time your tongue caressed the chicken. Paired with a $9 milkshake more expensive that a VCAT human rights claim, the Universal experience cannot be described as anything but divine.  In recent, unfortunate days, however, our beloved Universal experience has been corrupted. With the grace of malaria, the new management has caused an absolute degeneration of quality. My latest experience with Universal will most definitely be my last.  I was expecting pure bliss as my mouth opened to take my first bite of my parma.  I was not expecting it to taste like fish.  Confused with the stark contrast between horrid taste in my mouth and the unassuming piece of deception in front of me, I double, triple, and quadruple checked my order before the realisation of how far the greatness of this sanctuary has fallen. I felt an transcendental feeling of betrayal, worse than how Jesus must have felt when he felt Judas' kiss. It was then when I realised that my childhood was coming to a close; the cold, bleak reality of adulthood was starting to settle in.  I long for a taste of the universal chicken parma. The taste of my childhood innocence.

Fine dining, tasting menu, with Japanese influence. Couldn't say no to all the add ons! So how was it? First up - the snacks - There were A LOT of snacks. Most of which were great, if not a little too heavy.  The bread was delish and the butter was very "nori-ed" - for lack of a better term. The add-on omellete was fluffy and yum with generous serves of crab. Perhaps the most disappointing dish was the A5 Wagyu - it didn't melt much and was very meaty in its taste.  Overall a great menu - we were completely stuffed by the end - it was a very filling tasting menu.

Our favourite restaurant in Melbourne. Chef Kazuki and his wife Saori are such an asset to the hospitality industry, and their team are wonderful. Food is always thoughtful, creative and beautifully presented. Can‚Äôt wait to come back once again.

Kazuki captures native Japanese food and pairs it with the best Australian produce. Chef Kazuki strives for balance and simplicity.  The snacks were presented all at once, which was a pleasant surprise. Seeing the detail of every dish really showcased their refined skills. Every little bite was done extremely well. Little savoury explosions of flavour!  For mains, there wasn‚Äôt a single dish that we didn‚Äôt like. Everything was balanced and presented beautifully. Kingfish paired fantastically with the buttermilk and mango. The lobster was outstanding, probably the highlight dish for me from the tasting menu. For the duck dish, Kazuki served 2 different parts which is very rare in most restaurants. Most restaurants default to the breast but Kazuki took it one step further to include a thigh piece, which is a plus in my books.  We added the infamous omelette with the crayfish. This has been on their menu for a very long time so we had to try it. It was ridiculously good - every bite was savoury, rich, sweet, delicate and decadent.  The desserts were great finishers to the meal. Not only are they beautifully presented but they tasted phenomenal. The cocktails were also right up our alley.  Highly recommend trying Kazuki‚Äôs if you haven‚Äôt.
Fantastic meal. While not cheap it was hard to fault anything. Great for a special occasion.

What an amazing experience. Interesting food with incredible flavours and fantastic service. I felt the proportions went a little far when something on my entree plate was replaced (due to my dietary issues) with half a mini spring roll with carrot and cucumber... why couldn't I have a whole one? After 7 courses, I was just full enough but ended up eating again soon after the meal. It wasn't enough for me, and there was no option of additional food.
Unbelievable meal.   So delicate, so complex, just wonderful flavors.  A great wine/sake pairing as well.   And amazing service.  A must try.

Food 4/5 Service 2/5 Ambiance 3/5  Food - yes it's good. It's not exceptional but it is pretty good. Def much better Japanese food in Melb.  Service - pretty poor tbh. A few times I tried to get attention and there were the 3 mains staff in the bar chatting ignoring everyone. One guest at our table asked for a scotch on the rocks.  We suggested trying a shot of Japanese whisky and the bartender/owner? said he would select one which we agreed to as we don't know anything about whisky and said we hadn't looked at the menu. Well the guy decided to take advantage of our ignorance and give us the most expensive shot of whisky on the menu - $120/shot. Felt like the sort of scam you hear in Greek island bars.  Secondly, our group of 4 was having great conversation which the staff constantly insisted on interrupting to agonisingly explain exactly what was already written on the menu. And whenever we asked further detail about what an ingredient was, they didn't even know! So what was the point?  Ambiance - from our table in centre of restaurant, we watched the kitchen staff eating food and also the cars tearing up Lygon st. Decor is trying to be minimalist Japanese but comes across like a bland business motel.  Overall ovoid

We had a very good dining experience, our menu is from February 11, the menu as a whole is advancing in layers, our favorite is the swordfish, its transparent tomato jelly is simply the biggest surprise, all dishes have different layers and details, the service as a whole is also very attentive, the only regret is that the waiter seems to be forcing to recommend additional dishes for the synergy menu, this is also understood at the end.

This was an amazing experience. Well out of my usual budget, but well worth it for a special occasion. We had the set tasting menu 7 perfectly designed dishes presented beautifully all amazing to eat‚Ä¶real food. The drink paring menu was special too. The whole party enjoyed every dish‚Ä¶ ( even those who usually think chicken schnitzel and chips is exotic). Each dish and drink was explained when served. A tour through food sensations.

I was quite excited to try Kazuki as it was named the top 50 restaurants in Melbourne by Broadsheet. Great ambience and service was excellent, the staffs were friendly and courteous. My friend and I had the 7course menu which I‚Äôve included in the photo album attached to this review, and we felt that the specials that were not on our menu were the highlights of the night. We went for the 2/3 specials namely the Omelette with lobster bisque and the Wagyu. Oh and the house-made bread was delicious. We ended up consuming so much more carbs from the bread that they kept offering to us. Everything else was okay. Only let down was the lamb and the desserts. The fish was perfectly cooked but the condiments didn‚Äôt go well together; the abalone and scallop dish was lovely. There were a good selections of alcohol and non-alcoholic drinks. Presentation of the food was great. Overall experience and taste of food 3.8 out of 5.
Extraordinary food, wine, service and surroundings in the heart of Carlton.

Visited this place last night, which was incredible with everything. Their finger food was delicious and perfect with all the ingredients. My fav one was the ox tongue. While the kingfish with green mango were great combination. Though my fav one was swordfish with eggplant. The only deducted point was because I‚Äôm not cheese person. Which served as their first dessert course.

Had a great night by staff‚Äôs superb services, and also Mr kazuki‚Äôs brief explaining on every courses from kitchen, great wine line and oh boy that koshu was packed with umami, toilet located upstairs was cozy, was going to toilet before first course stumbled them walking out to serves first course, immediately they made a u-turn back to kitchen just to wait for me to finish with the toilet businesses, that alone ladies and gentlemen was the greatest impression of me towards kazuki‚Äôs, very thoughtful, also special mention their‚Ä¶.  Seaweed butter! Seaweed butter! Seaweed butter! Seaweed butter! Seaweed butter! Seaweed butter! Seaweed butter! Seaweed butter! Seaweed butter! Seaweed butter! Seaweed butter! Seaweed butter! Seaweed butter! Seaweed butter! Seaweed butter! Seaweed butter! Seaweed butter! Seaweed butter! Seaweed butter! Seaweed butter!
Delightful atmosphere, delightful staff. I love the karaage here!

Overall tasty tasting menu. Loved most of the menu, the only thing was that the salmon dish was a little bit 'normal' for that price tag. Friendly service. However noted that the wait in between food got longer and longer as the night progressed which was a little annoying. Our guess is that the chef might have staggered it so that items can be cooked at same time...this means guests that arrive earlier might actually end up finishing more or less same time as others who started later.  This meant the whole dinner took over 3 hours...a suggestion to the waitresses would be to ask guests re the speed of serving up they would prefer.  This was the third time dining at Kazukis, looking forward to the next time .
Good food, excellent service
Perfect food. service and wine matching for our degustation dinner. Worth a visit.
Amazing food and service.

An excellent fine dining restaurants with Japanese influence.  Service is attentive and efficient. Food ingredients are of a high quality, and most dishes are well thought out with interesting flavours and fantastic presentation.

Wow, what an amazing experience. Kazuki's is fine dining without the excessive bells and whistles - just quality food that speaks for itself (but also thank you to the wonderful service staff that introduced each dish). An intimate dining space that somehow feels simultaneously fancy and homey. The wait staff were welcoming, attentive and knowledgeable. The way they talked about each dish and recommended drink pairings really showed off their familiarity with the menu and love for the restaurant. THE FOOD! I have had my fair share of Japanese fine dining, but Kazuki's almost immediately took a top spot in my mind. Each dish seemed meticulously prepared to bring out the natural flavours of the ingredients. The chef simply showcased their creativity without excessiveness. I won't comment on each dish as they were all amazing, but know that you should definitely visit if given the opportunity. The experience was well with the price! Looking forward to returning when we get a chance.

A small fine dining restaurant serving a five or seven course menu (only seven course for dinner), located on a busy section of Lygon Street. Had the seven course tasting menu which consisted of the following:  - Starters; there were seven bite size snacks, all were very tasty. Favourite was the spanner crab with sea grapes and the chicken pate puff - Bread roll was ok but the squid ink seaweed butter was unique with a distinct umami flavour - First dish after the starters was an eggplant wrapped in kombu, topped with toro, avocado and caviar. The top was rich, creamy and fatty, packed with flavour which was balanced with a soft vinegary base - Second dish was sliced abalone with mix vegetables, enoki mushroom and amaebi, tossed in a savory buttery sauce and topped with fried crunchy amaebi head. A pretty hearty dish - Third dish was a steamed hapuka filet with seaweed dust and scallop wrapped in leafy greens with parsnip sauce. Fish was moist, tender and meaty; paired well with the herby wrap filled with soft scallops - Fourth dish was a duck breast which was cooked well with a slightly crisp skin. The fried kale added a nice crispy texture; shaved truffle was very aromatic and the citrus jam made the dish more interesting with the sweet and savory flavour profile - First dessert was a light sponge cake with a brillat-savarin French cheese centre, served with finger lime and cream. Cheese was very strong and pungent, though the finger lime did help slightly - Second dessert was a flaky pastry filled with caramelised dice apple; texture wise it was great but the filling was too sweet and tart. Chestnut ice cream was mild in flavour; pomegranate jelly and avocado puree felt random and didn't really enhance the dish - Petit four was a dark chocolate truffle and a sweet rice crisp which was very crunchy  Overall food was great and the staffs were friendly and knowledgeable about the dishes. Wasn't fond of the desserts.
Average at best. Super friendly service, set menu was $200+ . Quality ingredients but unfortunately the flavors did not peak my curiosity‚Ä¶  Not sure Kazuki focusing on Japanese flavor or western
Extraordinary good. The quality of food is very high, matched with a fabulous wine list, and attentive service. One of the best lunches I‚Äôve had in Melbourne.

We took our oncology staff out for dinner . Service was slow . Food inconsistent . I spent over $ 5,000 on bill. Staff forgot to serve one guest desert . I asked waiter Alex for the additional serving to be provided and he snapped that they don‚Äôt have 25 pairs of hands and we need to wait . I questioned his authenticity and he remonstrated Absolutely no way we shall ever return A low class restaurant . Poor attitude . Go elsewhere . Do not recommend .

With all due respect, the food is very bad and we hope it will improve in the future. Madgout with chicken, strong sauce taste and dry chicken And the chicken mandi has neither smell nor taste  I wished that I would not write the comment here, and I tried to call and advise him on the phone, but he did not answer

Not real authentic mandi, meat quantity was tiny and not tender at all, very dry meat. Chicken was also dry and the spices are nothing like original Yemen and Saudi mandi. I understand there are limited options for mandi in melbourne but they need to up their game. Disappointed
Very disappointed with the chicken mandi we ordered for take away, the rice was extra salty , no flavour , chicken just felt boiled in coloured salt water. Very disappointed.
It's just one visit to this place. Tried their kunafa which was good. Will update the rating for food after trying their signature dishes soon.

Tried Ramadan Iftar open buffet. Salads were OK. We didn't like the main courses ( mandi and pasta) much. It's not as nice as the Yemeni Cuisine we are used to. Chicken mandi and pasta dishes were smelly. Soup was blant. Their lamb was nice, but rice was cold and not like how the mandi rice should be. Space was very tight. I think it would be better for a  la cart style and not as an open buffet.

Unfortunately, my experience at that place was pretty bad. They didn't provide us with the dates to break our fast, and the food selection was limited at the buffet dishes. On top of that, there was no call to prayer made in the restaurant and the prices were way too high!

Amazing chicken Mandi. Terrible service. I would still go there because I love their chicken mandi... but seriously, the number of waitresses and waiters need to increase! Also, it is not child friendly. inside is cold and the high chair is not safe. But again, the food is really delicious: 5star. Service: 1 star

I heard positive comments about this restaurant and I prepared myself to have a fantastic night there, but it was anything away from being even good! It was eight of us gathering there to celebrate our new year on a Monday night, at the moment I stepped in I felt I‚Äôm not that welcomed as the waitress looked abit tired that was understandable to me as they were too short-staffed! In fact, I put the blame on the manager who didn‚Äôt hire enough staff and put all the pressure on the poor waitress! The meal was good still I expected it to be more spicy. Last but not least, the worst part was that they forgot to bring our friend‚Äôs meal. When he asked for it (after waiting for too long!!) they were like we ran out of it! Couldn‚Äôt they have given us a notice! Anyway terrible experience!

I love the Lamb Mandi from here ‚ù§Ô∏è
Best Mandi in Melbourne!

Walked in for a late dinner after reading about this place on 40 under 40$, an article by Dani Valent. It is a cosy and homely restaurant with traditional Yemeni dishes that are packed full of robust flavour and chutzpah. The Adani Tea is fragrant, sweet and refreshing (much like Indian masala chai)! The lamb mandi is slow cooked roasted lamb piled over fragrant and very well cooked basmati rice. Each grain is separate and the unctuous lamb fat and marrow.ooze over the rice, further seasoning it. The lamb itself is fall off the bone tender and the flavour is unbelievable. It is served with tomato water, white sesame sauce and a tomato and cumin heavy broth. It is a perfect sharing size for two; so comforting and satisfying. For dessert we had the kunafah, which is the perfect way to end the meal!

It was such a disappointing experience for us üëéüèª first the lamb was just a small amount and it wasn‚Äôt fresh we got sick after having the lamb mandi üëéüèª and the Areekah soooo small portion as well for $14!! and very dry!! Arabs generally known to be generous üëåüèªI‚Äôm Yemeni so I know the Yemeni food very well and I‚Äôm an old customer I used to order from them when they used to cook from home but the quality of the food has changed and the portions getting smaller and prices went up! and the service was bad we ordered Adani tea after dinner the girl forgot to bring it and it wasn‚Äôt busy we were the only 2 customers in there when I reminded her to bring the tea she said sorry my colleague turned the machine off! as I know the Adani tea makes in a pot! I would never go back!!
Food is great, but customer service could use some work, been there a few times and never seen them smile once, definitely need friendlier staff.
Great Yemeni food

I wish I could have tried the food on the 2-3 tables that were available. I found out I had to book ahead of time. Even when coming at 9 pm I was told a table would be free at 10. Take away wasn't even offered. Not good.

This is possibly the tastiest, most delicious food I have ever had eating out. Authentic Yemeni cuisine with all the aroma and spiciness you could wish for. Incredibly generous portions and everything cooked to perfection. Quick friendly service and the ambience dining in is an experience in itself.
Food is so tasty and spectacular ..brings me back to the time when i used to live in the middle east..they have majilis as well for a big family..my family and i enjoyed the delicious food.

Called them multiple times to order before picking it up but no one responded on the given number. Drove to the restaurant since Google shows they are supposed to be open from 9am to 1am. Reached around 12:15pm and found it closed with no signage or operating hours notices.
This place is quite nice and the chickens are tender . Rice is very flavourful and had good dining experience overall.
SOOOO GOOD!!!! prices very reasonable and the best mexican food i‚Äôve had outside of mexico! will definitely be on my regular restaurant rotation
slayed
Tasty Mex food. We were sited right at the door and the staff had the door open all the time. Combined with Melbourne chilly weather, not the best experience overall...
OMG, this place is awesome. I'm from California and I absolutely loved it.

Generous serving sizes, delicious flavours and very friendly, helpful staff. Authentic Mexican dishes. We hadn't made a booking for a Monday night but the staff were able to accommodate our small family.
Jalapeno bites are gross - they're laid in a slobber of mayonnaise and old rocket. Filled with gross cream cheese and served cold. Blurghhhh!
Always a great meal here.  The fries are exceptional...and everything is fab too.

Good food however overshadowed by extremely poor customer service and professionalism. Waited over 55 minutes for two tacos whilst the rest of our table finished their dinner and had their plates cleared. Avoid, Avoid, Avoid.
Food looks okay but not even remotely authentic. Prices are ridiculous and there‚Äôs always really terrible music playing far too loudly when walking by - won‚Äôt ever be eating here!

I attended a group dinner at this restaurant, prior to this, had heard positive feedback re the service and food. I personally liked the friendly and prompt staff, amazing service delivered with a smile on the face. Needless to say, food is amazing too. I lost my earring during that event, considering it's a small item and difficult to look for the next day, i still called pruthvi (owner) and let him know. He, along with his staff diligently looked for it and they found it. Kudos to you guys! Keep up the great job you doing !
Great service Food is delicious Drinks are great
Food looks good, place is clean, food has no mexican flavour

If you‚Äôre looking for delicious modern Mexican food with a twist, this is your place! üåÆ  Known for their incredible Daily Deals you MUST check out, including: üç∏ Monday Margaritas ($12 Margaritas every Monday from 5pm) üåÆ Taco Tuesday ($5 Tacos every Tuesday from 5pm) üçó Wing Wednesday ($1 Wings every Wednesday from 5pm) üçπ Thirsty Thursday (Buy 1 Cocktail and get 1 Free every Thursday from 5pm) üçπ Sangria Sunday ($25 Sangria jugs every Sunday from 5pm) + Bottomless Brunch for $69pp! ‚òÄÔ∏è  Highly recommend their Seafood Platter ($70 for 2ppl) which includes Fried Calamari, Char Grilled Corn, Crisps & Dips, Fried Fish Burrito, Chilli Grilled Prawn Tacos & Battered Onion Rings üôå  The tacos are a MUST TRY here üåÆ their Fried Fish Taco ($8) is seriously one of the best I‚Äôve had and the Chilli Lime Mushroom Taco ($7.5) is packed with flavour!  They have stores in Carlton, St Kilda, Hawthorn and Hampton!
Food is tasty and variety is great. Weekly specials are good value and service is good. Sometimes the taco shells and buns they use are stale however.

A great place for friends for a celebration. The atmosphere is electric and the service is wonderful. The food though can be hit or miss. It's not as vibrant or fresh as I've had in other Mexican places. Especially the pulled beef or pork just is a little salty or just not that very rich or fresh.
Excellent mexikan Food. Even my Mexican husband approved and I will tell you that means a lot because he is picky and and makes excellent Mexican food himself.

Gorgeous bright little restaurant  set in the heart of Carlton with delicious tastes of Mexico. The hot cauliflower wings & corn  (pictured) were delicious! The cauliflower could do with a little more spice though considering they're meant to be spicy. Still, totally yum! My friends had the burrito bowls which they loved. The chips were very yummy too. The staff is lovely, very quiet but opened up a little the more we engaged them. Great value for money too. We will definitely be back!
Went for a 30th to the upstairs function room, great lighting and outdoor balcony area! Staff were very friendly and hosted with a smile the whole night even for a rowdy bunch! Thank you
Friendly service, food and wine were wonderful and were prepared in good time! Couldn't have had a better experience.
The prawn pizza and the lasagna great!
Outstanding pizza & pasta. Made with love as they say. Delicious. Thankyou

Lovely place with good food, nice staff and really moderate prices!
The waiters were very nice. Particularly to the kids! Food was excellent!
The staff are awful. Very very rude.

A seafood risotto with chorizo and calamari was on the specials board. Chuck in a nice Jim Barry shiraz . $40 all up. Very enjoyable lunch. Couldn't believe the parking opportunities just around the corner in Pelham St.
Really enjoyed our meal and great service. Wide selection of dishes.
Good
Fantastic food and the option for Livenpay was also great! Their Princess pasta was one of the best pastas sauces I‚Äôve had

The food was average, the 'main' sized pasta was tiny. Garlic bread was soggy and underdone, and one serving was forgotten. But the worst part was how unprofessional the staff were. There was 5 girls standing around behind the bar laughing, hugging, fixing their hair, watching videos on their phones and one of them was licking a spoon. No regard for the fact that the bar is in full view of customers, or that there was tables waiting to order. This restaurant really needs to consider hiring staff with more customer service experience, as it looked like the whole place was run by teenagers.
Awesome meal and great service.
told more than an hour after we ordered that it was in the oven after we asked
Parking extremely difficult; excellent food-good portions, well priced, a little slow on the service, but very responsive when requested.
Terrific function area upstairs!
A very tasty pasta marinara that was buttery and delicious. Full of seafood and a gentle heat of chilli üå∂ üòã They were quick to correct the dish after the order was misunderstood. A great night

Dined here on a Monday night on the way to the Comedy festival. We walked in without a booking and the place was almost full, however they managed to fit us in. The host was lovely and we enjoyed lasagne and a Mexican Pizza-both excellent. Efficient service and well priced. The place has a lovely atmosphere and is such an icon in the vicinity. Truly good Italian food. Will visit again.  Highly recommended.
Quick friendly service, food came out really quickly and tasted great
Great selection of food, staff service was alright
Nice place to visit on Lygon street, had the veal schnitzel which was pretty decent

Poor service - couldn't get another chair on our table just because it'll block the other table when there was clearly no other customers at the restaurant at that time  Food was a bit disappointing
Best Authentic Italian restaurant in Melbourne

Perfection. Quality of service was best we‚Äôve experienced in years of dining. Atmosphere, decor, vibe, and of course, the food. Absolutely exceptional. Among the best Italian we‚Äôve ever had. Pasta was divine, entrees were beautiful and desserts were delectable. The service is worth another mention. We felt so beautifully looked after. Cant recommend enough. Thank you Guido chefs and front of house team!

Great food and wine, ambience and the wait staff are top level. Went with family tonight. From start to finish, the service and food was amazing and it topped off my visiting family's holiday on their last night. If anyone is looking for an authentic Italian restaurant, then this is the place!

Beautiful setting, wonderful service and great food - can highly recommend the Spaghetti con le Cozze and the Agnolotti al Nero di Seppia. We had a cheeseboard and desserts to round out the night with a recommended paired dessert wine.  Will definitely be going back!

One of the best place for Italian food, handmade pasta with authentic Italian flavors , gorgeous! to die for dessert. If this is my last meal on earth, I can die a happy person. The service is amazing, the wine list is well ranged (ask for Italian wine recommendations) I will definitely visit again . Highly highly recommend.
Delicious food and amazing friendly service.

delicious! The several pastas I ordered are very good, especially the tomato macaroni is delicious, and the service attitude is very good. The black coffee poured on the tiramisu neutralizes the bitterness, and the taste is very good~
Wanted to eat here but the waitresses totally ignored me and my partner after making eye contact multiple times. Who knew preparing a table was a 2 man job

We went to Da Guido as a family last night and 'wow'.  It's a beautiful italian restaurant at the city end of Lygon St and the food and staff were amazing.  2 great pasta dishes, a caprese salad which took us back to the local markets of Italy and a risotto, not on the menu, and made just for me by the chef.  Customer service like this is a rarity in this post-covid world where often hospitality staff appear to either 'not care' or appear 'arrogant' and at Da Guido, Mirko and his team really care.  I definitely recommend you go here and experience great food and great service in a lovely setting.
Great food and wines, helpful staff and cosy environment.

Food was good for the price, portions were on the small side and charging for cold bread and charging separately for a small dish of oil or butter strikes me as pretty stingy. Is it normal for higher end restaraunts to charge for bread?
Amazing food. Great service. Will definitely going back there when I'm in Melbourne next.
Overall, it‚Äôs pretty good. The pasta and ravioli are both delicious, but the price is a little bit expensive. The decoration style is suitable for more formal dining, suitable for couples dating.
Excellent food, wine and attentive service. Wonderful wine advice too. Our group enjoyed every minute and every bite at Da Guido La Pasta. Italian pasta at its best.
Nice place with great food and service.
Great place, friendly staff. Food great, just wanted more üòâüôÇ Very helpful when I asked for a particular recipe üôÇ
Fantastic experience, Wonderful seafood flavours through the pastas. Would come back again.
A wonderful surprise.  Great service, great food and a really stylish restaurant.  Can‚Äôt wait to go back and try another of their meals.

Went there with some friends. The pasta was delicious. Very friendly and welcoming service.  We had 3 different kind of pasta and just shared everything. The fagottini filled with spinach were our favorites!  I definitely will go back and try the other dishes.

We had a lovely dinner here tonight for my husband‚Äôs 40th birthday. We sat in the corner by the window and even with a full house, we could still hear each other and the music. The food was bloody delicious - had the Wagyu ravioli, Spag cozze and gnocci. So so good! Highly recommend for homemade pasta with authentic flavours. Service was top notch too.

We rocked in late and were greeted with wonderful, friendly and professional service, delicious food (bruschetta, pasta and dessert), and didn't feel hurried in the slightest despite being the last table left. Decor is delightful, too. I'll be bringing my mum here.

Super relaxed and authentic atmosphere with the nicest service ever, thanks to all of you guys! We had a beautiful first night in Melbourne, so happy we found this gem. Oh yeah, sorry, the food? Was just perfect ‚ô•Ô∏è

Mirco‚Äôs service tonight was amazing, we loved each main that came out from the kitchen, wouldn‚Äôt want to spend my birthday any other way. Thank you to the team who made the night memorable, and the chefs who executed the perfect birthday dinner.
